events.name: International Freight and Logistics update: ports, planes & airfreight assistance package
events.summary: As a valued stakeholder you are invited to participate in an “International Freight and Logistics update: Ports, Planes & Airfreight assista
events.description_html:
As a valued stakeholder you are invited to participate in an “International Freight and Logistics update: Ports, Planes & Airfreight assistance package” briefing on Wednesday, 22 April 2020 from 3:00pm to 4:00pm (AEDT). The briefing will focus on impacts to Australian businesses engaged in global trade and supply-chains (export and import) resulting from the current global situation. There will also be an update on the Federal Government’s international freight support measures.

 

International Freight Assistance Mechanism

 

On 1 April 2020 the Australian Government announced the $110 million International Freight Assistance Mechanism (IFAM) to help restore critical global supply chains for premium Australian agricultural and fisheries producers, who have been heavily impacted by COVID-19 containment measures around the world.

 

Under the IFAM, planes will take off from key Australian ports with a focus on those locations to enable access to regional and rural Australia and deliver to key global markets such as China, Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore and UAE carrying premium Australian seafood, red meat, dairy and fruit and vegetables.

 

On return, these flights will bring back medical supplies, medicines and equipment to Australia to support our response to COVID-19.

 

Read the Air freight fact sheet to find out more.

 

The briefing will cover:

 

  • MC Wayne Murphy, Senior Export Adviser, NSW Treasury
  • Welcome by Peter Mackey, Director International Trade, NSW Treasury
  • Freight and Logistics update by
    • Marika Calfas, CEO, NSW Ports
    • Brian Lovell, CEO, Australian Federation of International Forwarders (AFIF)
    • Austrade representative
  • Moderated online Q&A session

 

Who should attend?

 

  • NSW businesses engaged in international trade and supply-chains

 

How to register?

 

  • Cost: Free (places are limited) and registration is required. Please use the Eventbrite registration link above. 
  • When: Wednesday, 22 April 2020 from 03:00-04:00pm (AEDT). 
  • Platform: Online (Skype – audio only)
  • Further information: +61 438 404 827, tania.panagoda@treasury.nsw.gov.au

 

Read Austrade’s COVID-19 updates for exporters for further information on the current situation. 

 

Privacy:  where you provide any personal information to the Department, you warrant that you have obtained all required consents from relevant persons for such disclosure, in compliance with the Privacy and Personal Information Protection Act 1998.

events.name: MONTHLY BUZZ: Raising Capital in a COVID-19 World [Webinar]
events.summary:
Raising capital is hard at the best of times - but what about at the worst of times? 
COVID-19 has rocked the global economy, and there is n
events.description_html:
Raising capital is hard at the best of times - but what about at the worst of times? 

COVID-19 has rocked the global economy, and there is no way of predicting the long-term effects this will have on businesses in Australia and beyond. Startups - especially capital intensive, harder to commercialise deep tech startups - are even more vulnerable. While capital is still in play, founders have been encouraged to push out their runway and raise as quickly as they can to set themselves up for a tough period ahead. 

Blackbird Ventures, Main Sequence Ventures, AirTree Ventures and OneVentures are four of the largest venture capital firms in Australia, all with an interest in deep technologies. Partners from each of these firms have generously agreed to participate in this one-hour webinar, talking about how they are looking at investing currently, what advice they have for founders raising at this difficult time, and answering all your burning questions. Founders far and wide - this is your chance to hear from the experts and ask them questions firsthand to enhance your chances of navigating the complex world of venture capital successfully at this crucial time. 

Our Panel

  • Sam Wong, Partner, Blackbird Ventures

  • Mike Nicholls, Main Sequence Ventures

  • John Henderson, AirTree Ventures

  • Michelle Deaker, OneVentures 

Our Moderator:

  • Dr Dharmica Mistry, Program Manager at Cicada Innovations


* Monthly Buzz is an ecosystem growing initiative by Cicada Innovations, generally taking place each month in our iconic Atrium space. We hope you enjoy the first virtual edition of our Monthly Buzz!

Presented by Trudy Johnston, Chief Bright Spark, Vim + Zest
Want a webinar full of robust content, imp
events.description_html:
How to Create Webinars Worth Watching

Presented by Trudy Johnston, Chief Bright Spark, Vim + Zest

Want a webinar full of robust content, impressive conversion and retention?

Today’s audiences are sophisticated and over-stimulated. They’ve seen all the tricks and tactics to gather their clicks. Your webinar must exceed their expectations to successfully lead them onto your marketing funnel.

This webinar shows you how to:

1. Structure your presentation with a problem/resolution framework
2. Use story-telling to engage your viewers
3. Build Thought Leadership and subject-matter authority
4. Give value – not hard sell
5. Design for visual impact
6. Delivery when you’re offstage and can’t ‘read’ your audience
7. Build your Personal Brand

Be on the front foot. Lead your industry. Support your business community.

Trudy Johnston, Chief Bright Spark, Vim + Zest

The leader’s leader. 27 years of senior PR and Marketing. Former University lecturer (UNSW, Masters level). Leadership and Personal Branding expert.

www.vimandzest.com

events.name: Kundalini Activation Process Online
events.summary:
Join us on Sunday nights at 7pm for an online activation!
What is KAP?
KAP is a direct transmission of kundalini or life force energy, that
events.description_html:
Join us on Sunday nights at 7pm for an online activation!

What is KAP?

KAP is a direct transmission of kundalini or life force energy, that activates the kundalini awakening process in participants. The energy is non local. That means it can reach you wherever you are, across time and space. 

Most people experience KAP as a deeply healing, transformative and cathartic experience that gives them deep insights & realisations. There can be profound shifts on a physical, emotional and spiritual level. KAP is a powerful tool for managing stress and promoting wellbeing. A profound rewiring of the brain structure and central nervous system happens with continued exposure. KAP needs to be experienced to be fully understood. 

What happens during a KAP session?

You lie down on a yoga mat and shut your eyes. Some music is played. The facilitator works energetically on some of the chakra or meridian points on or above your body to transmit energy to you. That's it. That's all that happens on the outside. What happens on the inside is a totally different story!

Everyone's experience of KAP is different, however most that attend have an extremely powerful experience.

For more information and video clip see www.venantwong.com 

Facilitator profile:

Caroline Lloyd and Cathy Newman are accredited KAP facilitators. They have been trained by Venant Wong, who founded the Kundalini Activation Process. 

LOGISTICS:

Please make sure you have downloaded Zoom before the session and are comfortable with how to use it.  If you need help, please contact us ahead of class so we can assist you. It is also highly desirable to have a speaker connected to your computer to amplify the sound, for a more powerful experience. You will need a quiet, private space where you can lie down on a yoga mat. You will need to position your computer camera so that we can see our full body on screen. The detals for the Zoom meeting will be emailed to you shortly before the class.

Your first online class is free. Subsequent classes are $30.00 (or $15.00 for Health Care Card Concession holders). However, if you are suffering economic hardship  please donate what you can afford. 

Ideally, try to eat lightly before the session & drink plenty of water.

Time: Arrival by 6:45pm for a 7 o'clock start.

PRIVACY STATEMENT

UNSW is collecting your personal information in this form for the purpose of providing you with more information about the UNSW Founders Program. As a result, any personal information you provide in this form will be processed by Microsoft. events.name: Breath-Training Workshop for Ocean Swimmers
events.summary: The 5-hour Clinic (3.5h land, 1.5h ocean pool training) designed by FREEDIVING INSTRUCTOR and life-long ocean swimmer, Michaela Werner, for
events.description_html:
The 5-hour Clinic (3.5h land, 1.5h ocean pool training) designed by FREEDIVING INSTRUCTOR and life-long ocean swimmer, Michaela Werner, for all ocean lovers who want to improve breathing, stay calm when held underwater, recover faster between sets and deal with big waves with much more confidence. The breathing skills that you will learn can and should used in your daily life.

There are just 10 spots at each Workshop, so please book early.

YOU WILL LEARN:

  • How to deal with anxiety around big waves
  • How to relax and stay calm, even if things don't go your way
  • How to move efficiently underwater
  • How to activate dive reflexes that all of us have to your advantage
  • How to master the power of breathing and use it in your every day life
  • How to recover quickly and effectively between waves 
  • How to train breath-holding safely 
  • The benefits of cold exposure training

SCHEDULE:

  • Introduction
  • Breathing / Physiology
  • Breath training exercises
  • Yoga for swimmers for strength and flexibility
  • Dive reflexes / Psychology
  • Ocean pool training
  • Hot shower (you'll need 20c), tea/coffee

Note: The schedule may vary according to tides.

YOUR INSTRUCTOR - MICHAELA

I'm a proud mum of 3, an ocean lover and a Freediving Instructor based in Newcastle. I'm passionate about the power of breath and I enjoy the daily health benefits the breath-training provides. I teach students to freedive up to 30m depth. I train others and myself so I can keep exploring the beauties of the ocean on a single breath. I spent more than 25 years of my life in the water - as a competitive swimmer, freediver, scuba diver, lifeguard, swimming instructor and a long distance ocean swimmer. Water is my home away from home. Let me show you how to stay relaxed underwater and how to train your body and mind so you can enjoy the benefits of every single breath. 

Most of us take breathing for granted, until the next breath is taken away by the ocean. If in this moment you fight the ocean, you lose. Instead, you should relax, let go and know that you can hold your breath, as you've done many, many times before. If you haven't - let me show you how to do it - safely.

WHAT TO BRING:

Yoga mat

Swimmers / wetsuit

Goggles

Towel

ANY QUESTIONS?

Call / Text: Michaela 0421 655 031

Email: michaela@apneaaustralia.com.au

events.name: BNI Network Collective || Breakfast Event
events.summary:
Do you  want to grow your business? Do you have a referral strategy?
Most businesses don’t have a strategy for referrals and yet it is the m
events.description_html:
Do you  want to grow your business? Do you have a referral strategy?

Most businesses don’t have a strategy for referrals and yet it is the most powerful and accelerated way of growing your business.

If you want to be part of a network that is working in a structured, professional and committed environment that guarantees to deliver referrals to grow your business, we welcome you to join us at our weekly business breakfast meeting.

About us

Yes, we are vibrant and proactive group, but we are also committed to deliver results with the strong motivation to pass on referrals to you.

We are basing our success and motivation on the motto: “Giver’s Gain”. Give first and in return your will gain more business for yourself.

We are a diverse group covering so many professions, that is making referring an easy task. Giving referrals is second nature to us.

About BNI

BNI - Business Network International is a business and professional networking organization, whose primary purpose is to exchange qualified business referrals. It is the largest networking organisation of its kind. BNI has over 8,000 chapters internationally and last year BNI generated $13.8B worth of business for each other.

About the Event

The event starts with informal opportunity to network and connect with people from professions that you wish to exchange with. After this part we start with the formal and structured section of the meeting. This is when you will have an opportunity to pitch your business, so we can learn more about you. At the end of the meeting you are welcome to continue networking.

Fridays weekly

6:30 AM

Registration and Open Networking

7:00 AM

Formal Meeting

              Introduction to the Group’s Structure

              Pitch your Business (guests & members)

              Member Show Case Presentation

8:20 AM

Q&A Opportunity for the Guests

8:30 AM

Meeting concludes

Don’t forget to bring 40+ business cards

 

For further inquiries, please refer to the member who invited you

or contact

Jacqueline Hofste 0433 433 754 or admin@networkcollective.com.au

NO REFUND POLICY

To enter before 6:30 press the buzzer and a staff member will open for you.

events.name: Agile Business Analyst (ABA) - Virtual Training, 24 April 2020 (AxisAgile)
events.summary:
To find out more about our company, view AxisAgile's Web Page
 
The role of Business Analyst (BA) changes in the Agile world.  Stay ahead
events.description_html:
To find out more about our company, view AxisAgile's Web Page

 

The role of Business Analyst (BA) changes in the Agile world.  Stay ahead with new techniqus, tools and tactics to guide your Agile team and support your Product Owner.

Our Agile BA course is an engaging 1-day session designed to provide Business Analysts with the knowledge and techniques to optimise the delivery of requirements, ensure that teams build relevant products and assist Product Owners manage the demands of complex initiatives.

Based on the Agile Extension to the BABOK guide, this course builds its foundation on the industry's best practices.

 

Our virtual course (laptop or desktop with Internet connection required) includes:

  • downloadable training materials;
  • real-time instruction; relatable examples;
  • AND the option to attend the same training course in-person at a later date at no additional cost

 

 

What is included in each course?

 

A copy of Scrum Shortcuts Without Cutting Corners

When attending our in-person session, you get a copy of Scrum Shortcuts Without Cutting Corners, the hugely popular book that was selected to be part of the 'Mike Cohn Agile Signature Series' (the premiere book series on Scrum and Agile globally). This book is full of great Agile tactics, tips and tricks that many have found to be invaluable. But don't take our word for it, check out the reviews on Amazon! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We're here to support you!

Don't worry, when you've concluded your training with us, we're still here to help via our free ongoing support. Email us with a question and we're sure to reply. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

USB pen with all electronic materials for each attendee

USB pens with the electronic course materials will be provided at the in-person session to help your team members focus on their training and re-enforce their knowledge after the course.

 


 


 

 

 

 

Workbooks to help you connect with the course

As well as an electronic copy of all of the slides and other materials, on the day of the in-person course you will receive a fill-in-the-gaps, workbook to use and follow along with during the course. This has been specifically designed to help reinforce key learnings.


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A sleek laptop case to keep it all together

Not only do we provide you with a whole host of great merchandise, but at the in-person course, we also ensure that you have an efficient way to take it all home with you via the neat laptop bag that you will also receive. You’re welcome!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This course covers 

  • Traditional vs Agile requirement analysis - Learn how the role of the Business Analyst changes
  • Agile Extension to the BABOK guide - Understand the three horizons and seven principles
  • User Story Mapping - See the whole, while gathering detail on what is most important
  • Where Business Analysts fit in - Understand how a BA fits within a cross-functional delivery team
  • Refining requirements collaboratively - Empathise with the customer, and observe requirements through their eyes
  • Product Backlog - Establishing a sequential delivery order to maximise value delivered
  • Product Backlog Refinement - Understand iterative and incremental analysis
  • Definition of Ready (DoR) - Control the quality of requirements
  • User Stories and User Story Splitting - Utilise the most popular Agile requirement format
  • Behaviour Driven Development (BDD) - Understand how concrete examples can drive out assumptions and ambiguity
  • Job Stories - Understand your customers’ motivations and deliver a result that delights them
  • Fully-dressed and casual use-cases - Use-cases are a valid alternative to User Stories when applied correctly on an Agile project
  • Non-functional requirements - How to include non-functional requirements as part of the Product Backlog and/or Definition of Done (DoD)
  • Kanban - Track BA activities, and optimise the flow of requirements
  • Sprint operations - Deal with changing requirements, disruptive stakeholders, and teams that ask for unecessary detail


 


Private ABA Course

Please contact us to discuss options for in-house, private ABA courses. 

 


Who Should Attend

Business Analysts, Business Architects, Requirements Engineers, Systems Analysts, Process Analysts or anyone involved on an Agile team interested in learning how the role of Business Analyst fits within the Scrum framework will all benefit from this course.

 

 

Group Bookings and Invoices

We also offer discounts for group bookings and invoicing as a method of payment. For more information please contact us now.


  

Refund, Replacement and Postponement Policy

If you have booked onto a course and aren't able to make your course date please refer to our Refund, Replacement and Postponement Policy

events.name: 2020 Sydney French Open
events.summary: The Sydney French Open is a tennis competition and fundraising event gathering together the French & Francophile communities in Sydney. This
events.description_html:
The Sydney French Open is a tennis competition and fundraising event gathering together the French & Francophile communities in Sydney. This seventh edition will take place at the Eastcourts Tennis Club in Kingsford on Saturday 18th and Sunday 19th April 2020

The Open is structured around three key draws:

  • Men,

  • Women,

  • Junior (11-13 & 14-17 years old).

  • You can also register for a Doubles draw. If you played the singles draw and lost early you can enter it free of charge.

The Charity

Since its early days, the Open’s main goal has been to support the Redkite charity whose mission is to help kids who have been diagnosed with cancer and need to leave New Caledonia to get long term treatment at the Westmead Children Hospital. 

The charity coordinator and her team of volunteers provide a wide range of services to families affected by cancer including emotional and logistic support which helps make the kids’ day to day life at the hospital a bit easier.

Important information

In case of severe rain forecast, the tournament will be rescheduled as soon as possible after the current date. We understand this might not be convenient for all players but registration fees will not be reimbursed if participants can't play on these dates. Remember that all proceeds will go to RedKite!

events.name: Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC
events.organiser: Sydney Informatics Hub, Core Research Facilities, DVCR, The University of Sydney
events.summary:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series


Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC

Please note: OWN LAPTOP R
events.description_html:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series


Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC

Please note: OWN LAPTOP REQUIRED with a terminal client installed.

Essential pre-requisites: Competency on the Unix/Linux command line. If you are interested in learning HPC but have no Unix/Linux command-line skills, you MUST first take an 'Introduction to Unix/Linux' course. These are scheduled regularly on campus.

Synopsis: Learn to navigate and interact with the University of Sydney's Research Data Storage options. Learn how to transfer data between your local computer, an external source, the Research Data Store (RDS) and the Artemis High Performance Computer (HPC). Learn how to back up HPC output onto the RDS. 

Target audience: Students and staff who would like to learn how to run compute jobs on Artemis HPC. Participants must have a valid USYD unikey.

Follow-on courses: This course is designed as a 2-part session, with 'Introduction to the Artemis HPC' in the morning and 'Data transfer and RDS for HPC' in the afternoon. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO REGISTER FOR BOTH.

Course notes and additional courses: https://sydney-informatics-hub.github.io/training.artemis/

For more information: Email sih.training@sydney.edu.au 

Sign up for email alerts about training: https://mailman.sydney.edu.au/mailman/listinfo/computing_training

 burrata - everyone's

In this hands-on workshop you will learn how to make mozzarella and the best of the stretched curd cheeses including:


burrata - everyone's favourite little bundle of deliciousness, filled with creamy stracciatella
AND
stracciatella - fine strands of mozzarella, mixed with cream and salt - the decadent filling of burrata!

What to expect:

Our morning starts with a cup of tea, pastries from Flour & Stone and a chat about how the day will unfold. Then it’s time to roll up your sleeves and feel your whey through the curds. We work in small groups so there’s usually plenty of banter and laughter and time for one-on-one attention.

By lunchtime, as we sit around a long table, stories and favourite recipes are shared and then with a smile and a full belly, it’s back into the kitchen to start stretching our curds.

And what makes my workshops all the more special and insightful, I’ll give you an abundance of recipes and remedies for the leftover whey. You’ll be taking it home by the bucket load!

events.name: WEBINAR 1: Farm Biodiversity Certification Scheme Trial
events.summary:
JOIN ZOOM MEETING
In 2019 the Australian Government announced funding for the implementation of an Australian Farm Biodiversity Scheme to be
events.description_html:
JOIN ZOOM MEETING

In 2019 the Australian Government announced funding for the implementation of an Australian Farm Biodiversity Scheme to be developed and led by the National Farmers' Federation (NFF). As part of the Agriculture Stewardship Package, the aim of the scheme is to reward farmers for managing biodiversity on farm through market-based mechanisms and thus enable the continued provision of natural capital benefits to the wider community.

The Australian Farm Institute (AFI) has been appointed to conduct Phase 1 of the Scheme, focused on desktop and consultative research, reviewing international best practice management standards for relevant agricultural biodiversity programs. The project for this phase will assess commonalities in existing methods and determine their potential applicability in Australian agricultural systems, and these findings will then underpin the practical development and trial of biodiversity market mechanisms to be developed in phases 2 and 3.

An integral part of Phase 1 is a series of consultative forums held in regional areas across the country between March and May to identify critical success factors that will be required for implementation of biodiversity schemes in Australia. After the initial desk review of international and domestic options, the resulting catalogue of schemes will be presented to stakeholders for feedback via open group forums (as welll as stakeholder meetings and key informant interviews) to assist in determining desirable and non-desirable elements of relevant schemes in relation to their applicability to Australian agriculture. 

Forums are free to attend, however RSVP is required. If you are unable to attend a forum in person, please register for a webinar.

  • SEE THE LIST OF OTHER FORUMS / WEBINARS

events.summary: What makes some conversations difficult? Why do we sometimes hesitate at the thought of having conversations we think of as difficult? How c
events.description_html:
What makes some conversations difficult? Why do we sometimes hesitate at the thought of having conversations we think of as difficult? How can we overcome this and feel more comfortable in having a difficult conversation?

As part of our spotlight on Displays Respect, this three-hour workshop is for UNSW staff looking to build their confidence in approaching and having a difficult conversation respectfully. Through reflection and exploration, participants will uncover the things that help and hinder success, setting you up to have a difficult conversation in a respectful and effective way.

We will cover the key foundations for challenging conversations, how to best prepare for a conversation, understanding the effect of emotional states during the conversation and ways to ensure the conversation stays on track.

You’ll have the opportunity to explore and practice some strategies and will develop a conversation plan to apply in an upcoming difficult conversation.

Please note that this is for UNSW staff only (fixed term and continuing).

events.name: Introduction to the Artemis HPC
events.organiser: Sydney Informatics Hub, Core Research Facilities, DVCR, The University of Sydney
events.summary:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series


Introduction to the Artemis High Performance Computer (HPC)

Please note: OWN LA
events.description_html:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series


Introduction to the Artemis High Performance Computer (HPC)

Please note: OWN LAPTOP REQUIRED with a terminal client installed.

Essential pre-requisites: Competency on the Unix/Linux command line. If you are interested in learning HPC but have no Unix/Linux command-line skills, you MUST first take an 'Introduction to Unix/Linux' course. These are scheduled regularly on campus.

Synopsis: Learn about the University of Sydney’s HPC ‘Artemis’, including directory structure, software, and how to submit and monitor compute jobs using the PBS Pro scheduling software. Also learn about the national HPC facilities and cloud services available.  Artemis is available at no cost to University of Sydney staff and students.

Target audience: Students and staff who would like to learn how to run compute jobs on Artemis HPC. Participants must have a valid USYD unikey.

Follow-on courses: This course is designed as a 2-part session, with 'Introduction to the Artemis HPC' in the morning and 'Data transfer and RDS for HPC' in the afternoon. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO REGISTER FOR BOTH.

Course notes and additional courses: https://sydney-informatics-hub.github.io/training.artemis/

For more information: Email sih.training@sydney.edu.au 

Sign up for email alerts about training: https://mailman.sydney.edu.au/mailman/listinfo/computing_training

events.name: Little Scientists STEM Computer Science Workshop, Erskineville NSW
events.summary:
Discover the concepts of computational thinking and learn how to “speak to a computer” by understanding how it works.


This STEM learning o
events.description_html:
Discover the concepts of computational thinking and learn how to “speak to a computer” by understanding how it works.


This STEM learning opportunity will help you:

  • playfully explore algorithms, sequencing and sorting

  • discover the basics of computational thinking

  • learn how to connect theory and practice in an engaging way

  • implement our inquiry-based educational approach

  • feel confident in unlocking the wonders of STEM

  • benefit from the exchange with other educators and teachers

  • take home information and inspiration in the Computer science booklet and cards you receive.

Feedback

'This is a fantastic workshop with lots of practical examples to take back and use in our program." Jenny Woo

Good to know: This workshop provides educators and teachers with a variety of tools and educational concepts to meet a range of requirements of the NQF and the EYLF.

Little Scientists workshops are endorsed to provide NESA Registered Professional Development for teachers accredited at Proficient Teacher level. Each workshop counts as five hours and 30 minutes of PD.

Date: Friday, 24 April 2020

Time: 9:30am - 4:30pm

Location: Gowrie Training Room, Level 1, 1 Elliott Avenue, Erskineville NSW 2043

Public transport: The closest train station is Erskineville Station and is a 5 mins walk from the venue.

Parking: Parking is available around surrounding streets of the venue.

Further information: wear clothing suitable for hands-on activities and experiments.

Cost: $200 per person. Ticket cost includes morning and afternoon tea. Please BYO lunch.

Who: this workshop is suitable for all teachers and educators and prior STEM knowledge is not required.

Facilitator: Lena Hammond, Little Scientists trainer

Bring a friend. We know from experience that people who come along with a friend or colleague tend to get more out of the workshop. If you know someone who’d benefit from this workshop, send them this link to find out more and join your workshop.

Please note: The workshop is for educators and teachers only and it is not suitable for children to attend.

Questions? Email us at workshops@littlescientists.org.au 

Terms and Conditions

Completing this workshop will contribute 5 hours and 30 minutes of NSW Education Standards Authority (NESA) Registered PD addressing Standard Descriptors 2.1.2, 3.3.2 and 6.2.2 from the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers towards maintaining Proficient Teacher Accreditation in NSW.

events.name: Yoga Class at the Sydney Buddhist Centre
events.organiser: feel-in(g) Yoga at The Sydney Buddhist Centre
events.summary: Yoga invites you to move consciously while connecting to your breathe. It helps to slow our minds down, bring awareness inwards and facilita
events.description_html:
Yoga invites you to move consciously while connecting to your breathe. It helps to slow our minds down, bring awareness inwards and facilitates the stillness required for meditation. Classes are open to all, regardless of finance, experience, age, shape, size and ability.

Classes led by certified yoga teachers Kate Sherman, Mariam Nakhla, Betsy Lea from Revel in Motion Yoga and Amelie Patrux from Feel-in(g) Slow Yoga.

EVERY SUNDAY @ 8.30 AM (Please arrive at least 5 minutes before the class as we start teaching at 8.30 sharp and you might interfere with other students who arrived on time).
All Welcome | By Donation (as much or as little as you can).

Experience Level: 
All - For all levels of experience

This class is BY DONATION - Our community at the Sydney Buddhist Centre is based on 'dana', the Sanskrit term for generosity – people giving their time and energy to create something together. We aim to offer our activities open-handedly. Please feel free to contribute as much or as little as you can after each class. There is a donation bowl available. Our teachers come on a voluntary basis.

FAQs

Do I have to bring my own yoga mat?

No, we provide all yoga props for this class including mats. They are second-hand but kept clean by cleaning them regularly. Feel free to bring your own if you wish or bring a towel to cover the mat.

What are my transport/parking options for getting to and from the event?

On Enmore Road, you can find 2-hour parking spots for free (don't forget to print the parking ticket). You can also go down the little streets around to find 2-hour free parking. If you are coming by public transport, the Newtown Train Station is a 2-min walk.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

No, just give your name on arrival.

events.name: Power BI Intermediate - Online Training - Sydney - 22 April 2020
events.summary:
Learn from the experts in Power BI
Agile Analytics training offers you the opportunity to get hands-on Power BI training from experts. Our
events.description_html:
Learn from the experts in Power BI

Agile Analytics training offers you the opportunity to get hands-on Power BI training from experts. Our trainers are interactive and draw on their experience to provide real-life scenarios that relate to the written materials.

We can solve your real-world problems during the class because we teach what we do in the field every day.

 

What will I learn?
This workshop is designed to take your Power BI expertise to the next level with comprehensive training in Tabular modelling, DAX and data visualisation. All you have to do is bring your laptop and we will supply the rest!

Topics:

  • Reports and Dashboards new features and best practices
  • Data modelling and DAX
  • Import, Direct Query, Live, and Composite mode
  • Row-level Security (RLS), static and dynamic options
  • Workspace and App best practices
  • Deployment options
  • Tips on Advanced Analytics using R & Python
  • Group project using your own data

 

What previous Trainees have said about their experience:

  • “I was concerned was that the trainer would just be reciting/presenting a straight textbook training course with no real knowledge of the material. You definitely proved to have practical and proven expertise in this space though”. – BI Manager, Retail Industry

 

  • “I was afraid that it may fall into the standard vanilla instructor reading off notes at the front of the room for two days. It was not – Informative, engaging, relevant.” – BI Developer –  NSW Government

 

  • “The course was really good, I got a lot out of it. The trainer was great at explaining everything and answering our questions. The examples we worked through were helpful. It gave us a greater insight into the tools available in Power BI and how we can use it to suit our business needs.” – Data Analyst – Qantas

 

Agile Analytics urges you to bring your laptop. Alternatively, you can contact us to organise a laptop for you (extra fee applies).

events.summary:
FREQUESNTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?
Yes, each participant must be 18 years or older at
events.description_html:
FREQUESNTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?

Yes, each participant must be 18 years or older at the time of completing the course and must present proof of their medical background on their training day.

What are my transport/parking options for getting to and from the event?

There is ample street parkiing avilable within the vicinity of the venue. The venue is located within walking distance of public transport.

What can I bring into the event?

Please bring a pen. A detailed manual and all materials and equipment are supplied.

What's the refund policy?

A full refund will be offered up to 30 days prior to your course date.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

Yes, please bring a printed copy of your ticket on your course day.

Is my registration fee or ticket transferrable?

You are able to transfer your enrolment for a fee up to 7 days prior to your course date.

Is it ok if the name on my ticket or registration doesn't match the person who attends?

No, the person listed on the ticket must be the participant in training on the course day.

Can I update my registration information?

Please email us at: pathologyfoundation@gmail.com to update your registration information. 

How can I contact the organiser with any questions?

Email us at: pathologyfoundation@gmail.com or phone us on: 0418103565

events.name: ITFA International Instructor Course & Black Belt Grading April 2020 (Taekwon-Do)
events.summary: ITFA HQ will be hosting the first NSW ITFA International Instructor Course (IIC) for 2020. The IIC will run on Saturday 18th and Sunday 19th
events.description_html:
ITFA HQ will be hosting the first NSW ITFA International Instructor Course (IIC) for 2020. The IIC will run on Saturday 18th and Sunday 19th April 2020, taught by ITFA Founder and Chief Instructor, Senior Master Andrew K H Rhee, VIII Dan. 

These events are open to all practitioners regardless of affiliation, from 2nd Kup (Red Belt) and above.

There will be 6 sessions over the weekend as follows:

Friday 17th April: VI Dan and above: Senior Syllabus Training/Examiner training, 2-5pm

Friday 17th April: IIC Dinner (For IIC participants only. Cost of dinner included in IIC ticket price) For more information on the dinner contact Miss Boulton Smith, info@itfa.com.au

Saturday 18th April: Morning Session ITFA IIC Session 1. 

Saturday 18th April: Afternoon Session ITFA IIC Session 2

Sunday 19th April: Morning Session ITFA IIC Session 3 

Sunday 19th April:  Afternoon Session ITFA Black Belt Grading/Pre-Grading for next IIC*

Registration will be from 8.30am for the morning sessions on both days. Line up at 8.45am for a prompt 9am start.

Registration for the afternoon sessions will be from 1.30pm, line up 1.45pm for a prompt 2pm start.

Morning sessions run from 9am-12pm

Afternoon sessions frun from 2pm-5pm

Early bird rates are available before 6pm Wednesday 18th March 2020. Closing date for applications 6pm Sunday 12th April 2020.

For more info about the ITFA go to www.ITFA.com.au or www.facebook.com/ITFATaekwondo.

There are no refunds so please take due consideration prior to applying.

events.name: Edge Business Networking Breakfast
events.summary: By attending our business networking breakfasts you will have an opportunity to meet and network with group members who have a very high cal
events.description_html:
By attending our business networking breakfasts you will have an opportunity to meet and network with group members who have a very high calibre of contacts and potential referral partners for you.

 A sample of some of the people you will meet includes:-

  • A branding director whose current / past clients include NSW Health, Westpac, NSW Treasury and more;
  • A business advisor who is a Start Up Australia ambassador and has a very high level of success in building, growing and selling businesses - both his own and other people's.
  • An IT specialist who performed global IT support for Virgin management senior execs on Richard Branson’s boat as well as assisting with IT for Kylie Kwong and Luke Mangan.
  • A bookkeeping agency Director whose current and past clients include Rachel Ruddick, One Teaspoon, FBI Fashion College, MaxMara, Matt Church and Fast Ed
  • An executive coach with contacts at BMW, Fox Sports, Ernst & Young and UTS
  • A natural health and fertility expert whose clients include ‘hatted’ chefs and well known actors

 and many others with amazing networks and contacts that they can introduce you to.

 

Please book in quickly as we only have a limited number of visitor spots available and they will go fast.

BNI - Business Network International is a business and professional networking organization whose primary purpose is to exchange qualified business referrals. It is the largest networking organisation of its kind. Currently, BNI has over 6400 chapters internationally. Last year, members of BNI passed 7 million referrals, which generated $3.2 Billion worth of business for each other.

 What makes BNI unique is that it allows only one person per classification to join a chapter.  Thus, once you have joined, none of your competitors can participate.

Remember to bring plenty of business cards to pass around, as you will meet lots of local business professionals.

events.name: Managing The Cyber Risks Of Remote Work [WEBINAR]
events.summary: Working remotely has meant we’ve had to rethink our approach to collaboration, productivity and delivering products and services — but what
events.description_html:
Working remotely has meant we’ve had to rethink our approach to collaboration, productivity and delivering products and services — but what about our security? Last week, news broke that Zoom is facing a huge privacy and security backlash as experts warn the video calling software isn’t secure enough. Meanwhile, we’ve recently seen an alarming surge in cyberattacks that allow hackers to steal sensitive data. 

Many of us are now more vulnerable to cyberattacks working from home, which is why we’ve partnered with AustCyber and Cynch Security to bring you a virtual panel on all things cybersecurity. Tune in to our webinar to learn what you can do to secure your digital footprint and protect your team from unknown cyber threats.


OUR SPEAKERS

Michelle Price, CEO of AustCyber 

Michelle is helping the Australian economy to grow through the development of a vibrant domestic cyber security sector, which is also supporting businesses to become more cyber resilient.  She has a background that spans the food industry, risk and governance and policy development – and has worked across government, academia and the private sector.

Adam Selwood, CTO and Co-Founder of Cynch Security

Extensively experienced in solving technology and cybersecurity problems, Adam is passionate about using his expertise to help smaller businesses that have nowhere else to turn. Prior to founding Cynch Security, Adam led Cyber Resilience initiatives within Australia Post.


OUR MODERATOR 

Sally Ann Williams, CEO of Cicada Innovations

events.name: Get hands on.
events.summary: More and more people are discovering the joy of Sri Lankan hoppers. Made from fermented batter, they are a fun and unique way to serve delic
events.description_html:
More and more people are discovering the joy of Sri Lankan hoppers. Made from fermented batter, they are a fun and unique way to serve deliciously healthy curry-based dishes and desserts.

Now, you can learn how to make them yourself at one of Hopper Kadé’s workshops. Running on selected dates, they give you the chance to learn more about Sri Lankan culture, flavours and cuisine - before getting hands on.

At the workshop you will begin with a welcome drink made from coconut arrack, a Sri Lankan liqueur. You will learn how to make hopper batter before trying your hand at making your own hoppers in our kitchen. The workshop finishes off with a three course tasting menu including dessert.

Included in the workshop:

  • Sri Lankan welcome drink made from toddy; a coconut liquor
  • Masterclass where you will learn about Sri Lankan cuisine, culture, how to make hopper batter, and you’ll get to try your hand at cooking hoppers
  • Enjoy a three course tasting menu
  • Hopper Kadé goodie bag

events.name: Free Anytime Online Repeat - 4 Ways to Be Happy for No Reason (Yes, Even Now!)
events.organiser: Art Galleries And Exhibitions In Bristol & Bath
events.description_html:
Free Anytime Online Repeat - 4 Ways to Be Happy for No Reason (Yes, Even Now!)

Location: Online via Zoom from your computer, telephone or mobile device
Cost: Completely free for everyone! Please share the registration link with your friends, family, and community: https://certifiedhappinesstraining.com/happy-for-no-reason-replay/?inf_contact_key=c670f093e2c09fefb0f8fa71e879bf687e470d92b8b75168d98a0b8cac0e9c09

"During this video gathering, we’ll offer 4 practical tools including:
How to transform fear into peace and ease
Choosing wisdom over worry -- stopping the downward spiral of your thoughts
Quick practices to overcome the blahs and raise your energy and vibrancy
How to give to family, friends or those in need without forgetting about yourself (or without feeling depleted)"

Marci: "How are you doing these days?
Many people I’m talking with say it feels like they’re on an emotional roller coaster ride every single day. Luckily for some there are still some beautiful highs. But what do we do about the lows and the downright scariness of the ride… especially now?

First of all, it helps to acknowledge the truth.
Yes, our sense of well-being is getting tested daily (perhaps even hourly if you suddenly find yourself home-schooling your children)! Now more than ever, it’s important to have the ability to easily access your sense of inner peace and balance.

Last week, I offered a free class (along with Kim Forcina) on The Power of Happiness During These Challenging Times. Thousands of people joined us and the feedback we’ve received from that session is awe-inspiring.

So we decided to offer another FREE LIVE session where we’ll share new practical and effective ways to spark happiness inside of you.

In this online video gathering, we’ll also answer your questions and do some personal coaching. You, your family, friends and community are all welcome to join us for “4 Ways to Be Happy for No Reason (Yes, Even Now!)”

events.name: Cabin Fever, House Bound
events.description_html:
Now that the Coronavirus is more popular than Facebook and we're all going a little stark raving crazy -- well, some of us -- sketch what you'd really love to do when we're all set free. Is it going and lounging on a cafe patio for a coffee, going to a movie, out for lunch, seeing the ballet, a concert, going shopping without fear? Anything you like!

If anyone has an idea how to make this better, please horn in!

events.name: CANCELLED DUE TO CORONAVIRUS
events.description_html:
The Moreleta Kloof Nature Reserve has a total area of about 100 hectares and was originally in the 1800’s a dairy farm owned by the Erasmus family. The homestead now functions as a quaint chapel, while another home has been converted into restaurant Rademeyers.

The nature reserve boasts a number of animal residents: impala, blesbuck, springbok, ostrich, zebra and many different bird species.

There are a number of walking trails of different lengths and intensities.
We will combine trails and walk around 5 to 6km. This will be a relaxed walk (no run walking) - we do stop for interesting animals, plants, views.

COST of walk - free
BRUNCH - pay for your own consumption

MEET AT 7.15AM FOR START OF WALK AT 7.30 sharp.

Parking is on the grounds of the reserve and is free.

After the walk we will have brunch at nearby Rock@88 Moreleta at 660 Rubenstein Dr, Moreletapark. According to Google maps the restaurant is a 2 min drive from the Moreleta Kloof Nature Reserve.
The entrance to Rock&88 Moreleta is next to and behind the Total garage.
_________________________________________________________________________
Participation in JOZI walks events and driving/carpooling to and from events is for the sole risk and cost of each participant. No responsibility whatsoever is taken by the host and organizer.

events.name: CRP March/APRIL theme: Stay Home <3 Stay Safe
events.description_html:
How is everyone doing? It is with our greatest hopes that you and your family and friends are staying well. And our heartfelt support to those directly experiencing the virus themselves or with loved ones. Our hearts go out to all of us feeling lonely, sad, confused, scared, angry, or burdened during this time. We are encouraging you to continue doing your part in staying home and staying safe from the Covid-19, coronavirus.

You are definitely encouraged to create art! But let's continue on NOT releasing any art in public places for the month of April, until further notice, in order to help halt the spread of this virus. Yes, it may very well lift someone's spirit to find a piece of thoughtful art during this time, but we must be vigilant in protecting our community from the spread of this virus through any shared handlings of your art, which may unknowingly spread the virus.

Let this unprecedented time inspire you, consider working themes around: Isolation, Community, Hope, Fear, Pandemic, Faith, Earth, Virus, Cure, Karma, Humor, Animals, Spiritual, Journey, Learning...

Let the feelings of how you are affected by this pandemic have some release through artistic expression. Let your art be your spiritual expression, your emotional expression, your down deep story that is being shaped by this experience. Let it be your reason for trying something new. Share it with us here in this MeetUp platform, or on our Facebook page, but hold those releases until the time comes that we are on the other side of this pandemic.

With love, stay well,
Michelle
Creative Release Project

IMAGE: Pandemic Loteria series, Rafael Gonzales Jr. https://www.instagram.com/pinche_raf_art/

HOW SUNDAY HUSTLE WORKS

events.name: Disruptive DIGIPRENEURSHIP FOR THE DIGITAL - MasterClass
events.description_html:
Disruptive Digipreneurship is a competitive advantage in the modern digital era for the futuristic business survival. Disruptive ideas of innovation can make the business flourish in social media world.

Disruptive Digipreneurship is a free 4 hour intensive mentorship program to prepare entrepreneurs for the future.

We teach you real-life lessons from various businesses, case studies, launch of new digital business, blueprints from various business models, maximize the profit based on minor changes in business system, learn tips, tricks and new technologies strategies to run business.

Our Motto is to create, learn and collaborative platform to take business from striving to thriving.

Disruptive Digipreneurship is exclusively a learning intensive for Aspiring entrepreneurs and Business owners of Small & Medium sized enterprises. It is not for anyone else.

This Intensive has limited seats of 25 members.

Real world, ready to apply business concepts are condensed into four hour sessions and continuous mentoring is also provided after the workshop.

If you are really inclined to learn and thrive in business, Invest now your time. You won’t regret.

The intensive dives deep into concrete modern real time concepts in modern entrepreneurship, Branding for 2020 & beyond, business architecture & amazing strategies in disruptive innovation to bring a giant leap in your business thriving.

Why is it crucial?

1. This valuable content is not included in any academic curriculum

2. Real-life lessons from various business case studies

3. Generating Ideas to launch a new business

4. Differentiate the Blueprints from various business models

5. Multiply the business by “Business Networking”

6. Learn tricks, new technologies and important tips in Business (Successful strategies)

7. it’s an intensive course for you to learn the right way of entrepreneurship and evolve your business or Business idea - Thrive a Business with your minimal intervention.

8. You will learn the scientifically-proven blueprints to make your business.

IMPORTANT NOTES:

1. Registration is mandatory. Entry is FREE. Refer your friends and spread the word.
2. Entry is restricted beyond 9.30 Am. Kindly be on time.
3. Mobile phones have to be turned on silent mode during the event. Usage of mobile or any other electronic gadgets is strictly prohibited during the event.
4. Kindly bring at least 50 Business cards.
5. kindly submit the summary of the book APRIORI for discussion to the what's App [masked].

Register Now: https://www.townscript.com/e/disruptive-digipreneurship-for-the-digital-era-work-shop-002031

events.name: The 4|20 Experience - LIVE - Virtual Two Day Cannabis Conference & Expo
events.organiser: Los Angeles - Cannabis. Blockchain. Startups. & Investing.
events.description_html:
(Full 2-Day experience starts: Sunday,[masked] at 1:00 pm EST, and concludes Monday,[masked] at 7:00 pm EST)

Greetings Friend! Be sure to join us for the LIVE - 4|20 Experience!

The 4|20 Experience provides as a substitute for the numerous IRL events that were unfortunately canceled amid the COVID-19 crisis. Fortunately for the 4|20 Experience team, we have all been passionate about creating an educational space for canna-preneurs, educators, and enthusiasts to collaborate and cross-connect; despite the current limited IRL event capabilities.

Our mission - now more than ever - still supports the overall goal of Hope Wiseman (Organizer) which is to kill the stigma the country has created about cannabis within minority communities and help African Americans realize the importance of their place in the cannabis industry.
This virtual conference and expo is for the aspiring cannabis/hemp entrepreneur looking to learn from and connect with others about cannabis as a science, medicine, business, policy, and lifestyle. Be sure to visit 420experience.co to purchase tickets and to learn more about the event.

___________

OVERVIEW:
- 2 Days - April 19-20, 2020
- 30+ Speakers
- 10+ Panels & Workshops
- Live Networking
- Entertainment
- Tickets: $4 for the first 200 registrants / $20 Regular - Full Access

***Speakers, Sponsors, And Exhibitors Added Daily, once you click "ATTEND", on this post, be sure to click the - registration link - under the event location to secure your virtual seat***
___________

WHAT WE'LL BE COVERING:

- BUSINESS: Take a look inside the evolving and complex licensed and ancillary industries. Walk away with practical knowledge to apply to your budding career or business.
- LIFESTYLE: What’s a Cannabinoid? How do I microdose? Does CBD really work? If you’ve ever asked yourself those questions then you’ll love what we have in store. Our panels break down the science of THC and help you find a way to create your cannabis lifestyle.
- POLICY: What does the future hold for federal legalization and medical programs? Get a political snapshot from the top leaders and trusted voices influencing and drafting cannabis regulation.

___________

WORKSHOPS:

- Cannabis Science: Lifestyle
- Shifting Cannabis Culture: Business/Lifestyle
- CBD Yoga: Lifestyle
- PR & Cannabis: Business
- Cooking with Cannabis: Lifestyle
- History, Myths Debunked: Lifestyle
- Business Planning: Business
- Pregame Workout & Session: Lifestyle

___________

PANELS:

- Ancillary Services: The industries backbone - Business
- The Golden Ticket: Breaking down the licensing process - Business
- Pot N Politics: A discussion between industry leaders and political figures - Policy
- Justice & Joints: A discussion on community-based organizing and marijuana justice reform - Policy
- CBD Panel - Business

___________

LIVE ENTERTAINMENT:

- Sounds by DJ T Lewis!
- A virtual smoke session with your favorite cannabis influencers.

___________

events.name: Martin Köppelmann on the Gnosis Protocol
events.description_html:
We are very happy to have Martin Köppelmann [1] speak to us in an online event about the Gnosis Protocol [2]. Martin was an active organizer of this meetup in[masked] until moving and continues to work on Ethereum-related projects, including the Circles UBI [3].

Martin will talk on the Gnosis Protocol which will open on April 15. It is a fully permissionless DEX that enables ring trades to maximize liquidity. Ring trades are order settlements which share liquidity across all orders, rather than a single token pair, enabling trades for illiquid or long tail tokens that would normally not be possible using a traditional order book. Trades are settled in batches (batch auctions). Ultimately it will also be used for trading prediction market tokens and all tokenized assets.

Martin will also introduce several prediction markets around COVID-19.

This event will be held entirely online; use the link [4] below. To check the correct time in your time zone, see [5]. As always, the meetup is funded by the Decentralization Foundation [6].

[1] https://twitter.com/koeppelmann
[2] https://docs.gnosis.io/protocol/
[3] https://www.joincircles.net/
[4] https://zoom.us/j/892201670
[5] https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/converter.html?iso=20200419T170000&p1=1241&p2=1440
[6] https://d24n.org/

events.name: CANCELLEDOff Road Adventure Rider Training w/ West 38 Moto
events.description_html:
West 38 Moto offers off-road training for adventure and dual sport riders at the beginner, intermediate and advanced levels. We conduct our training weekends near the town of Borrego Springs which is 2 hours east of San Diego. Join us for a training experience that we are sure you will enjoy and will take your current riding skills up a notch or two!

Our training starts at 9:00 am Saturday and will be finished by 4:00 pm Sunday.

2-Day Training Only – $499
-Meet up Saturday morning at 9:00 am 7 miles outside Borrego Springs
-If you choose this option we will email you the specific meet up
location.
-Find your own lodging at nearby hotels or air bnb
-Provide your own breakfasts and dinners (lunch is provided on training
days)
-Please join us for after training for festivities including fire side chats,
sharing riding experiences and a drink or a snack or two!

2-Day Training and Camping - $599
-If you choose this option we will email you the specific meet up
location. Please arrive no earlier than 3:00 on Friday afternoon before
training or no later than 9:00 am Saturday morning of the training.
-All meals are provided including Friday dinner through Monday
breakfast. Bathrooms and shower are available.
-Bring your own RV or tent and camping gear
-Enjoy a relaxed camp atmosphere with like minded moto folks

*Below are descriptions with links to our site (for more detailed training information) and a place for you to sign up for training!

Beginner - Maybe you just started riding or are a seasoned vet, but it's been awhile since you have ridden off-road or maybe you have never ridden a heavier more powerful motorcycle off-road. We are here to help! Below is a link to our website with details on our Level 1 training. You can also choose a date and sign up on this page!

https://west38moto.com/training-overview-off-road-motorcycle-training/train/

Intermediate - Have you been riding adventure bikes for years but with no formal training? Perhaps you’re looking to “refresh” training that you took 1, 3 or 5 years ago? Have you already taken our Level I Training and looking to take the next step and up your game? Or maybe you just want to take a refresher course each year to kick off the riding season. If you’ve answered yes to these questions, Level 2 Training is for you. Below is a link to our website with details on our Level 2 training. You can also choose a date and sign up on this page!

https://west38moto.com/training-overview-off-road-motorcycle-training/train-int/

Advanced - Don’t be fooled by the word; you don’t have to aspire to be Chris Birch to take our Level III Training, but you do need a strong desire to perfect your riding techniques. You must also take our Level II Training as a prerequisite to this class.

https://west38moto.com/training-overview-off-road-motorcycle-training/advanced-training/

Feel free to email me directly with any questions.

[masked]

events.name: Cancelled: Thousand Trails Idyllwild. Overnight motorcycle camping
events.description_html:
Due to the Coronavirus, Thousand Trails is closed. In accordance to Riverside County's "stay at home" orders running through April 30th, this ride had to be cancelled.

This is a special motorcycle trip to a very nice place: Thousand Trails, Idyllwild. This is a massive location with 252 campsites.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=110&v=oUPVvWW11rI&feature=emb_logo

Thousand Trails is one of the largest networks of RV resorts and campgrounds in North America, with over 80 locations in 22 states and British Columbia. Thousand Trails Idyllwild is a professional camping experience.

The Idyllwild location is complete with a fishing hole, lodge (with wifi), pool, hiking trails, rock climbing, bathrooms, water, BBQ pits, picnic tables and more. The campsites are secluded and rustic. This is a perfect place for an overnight camping excursion. It's not too far from home, and the beautiful town of Idyllwild is nearby.

Pot Luck dinner!
This is a great way to break bread with your fellow riders. Prepare something at home, and bring along enough to share. We can reheat everything on site, and set up a feast to remember.
For the first time ever, the Free Riders will be experiencing an overnight excursion without a hotel. Just the bright stars, a roaring campfire, your great friends and dinner outdoors.

Notes: Everyone must be in a tent for this excursion. 6 persons per campsite, but multiple adjacent campsites are available. Meetup at the Carl's Jr. near Tom's Farms. One way distance is 65 miles. Brings lots of food, a propane camping stove might be handy, and somebody bring some s'mores! I'm bringing bacon!

Okay you outdoor types, RSVP and let's ride!

events.name: Morning Ride to Chaya Someswara Swamy temple
events.description_html:
#EarlyMorningRide #
#90km nonstop ride

Sri temple was built during 11th - 12th centuries by Cholas. The temple got the name as it is believed that the formation of relentless shadow (Chaya in Telugu) of a pillar falls over the main deity of Shivalingam throughout the day. This amazing temple, engineered by the Kunduru, testifies the fantastic creative thinking and scientific knowledge of its architects. The complex houses three deities - Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva facing three different directions connected by common mahamandapa. The temple also demonstrates wonderful sculpture and art work.

events.name: Borrego Springs, Carmelita's Mexican Grill
events.description_html:
Reminder, this is a "Sunday" ride. Not Saturday

Smack in the middle of Anza-Borrego Desert State Park lies the unpretentious town of Borrego Springs, population 3,429. It’s the only California town that is completely surrounded by a state park, and that’s just one bullet point in its list of bragging rights. It’s also an official International Dark Sky Community—the first and only one in California—dedicated to protecting the night sky from light pollution. Backyard stargazing parties happen almost every night. Then there’s the ruby red grapefruit season, which begins in late December and ends when all the grapefruit are eaten. Some local fruit stands are run on the honor system: pick up a bag and place your money in the box.

The downtown area has a passel of ice cream shops, restaurants, and lodgings, but the local art scene evokes the most community pride. First, there are the supersize prehistoric and fantastical beasts that both line area roads and are sometimes seemingly dropped randomly in the middle of nowhere, far from any road or foot traffic. Insider tip: A map with the GPS locations of all the sculptures is available at the Anza-Borrego Desert Natural History Association desert store, which is one block west of downtown’s Christmas Circle. The meticulously crafted metal creatures, rust-colored and featuring such details as curling eyelashes and “fur” of shaved iron, are the work of metal sculptor Ricardo Breceda. Then there are galleries with more works by local artists, the Plein Air Invitational painting event and the Circle of Art Show, both in spring. Get your own art on with a watercolor or pottery-making class offered by the nonprofit Borrego Art Institute.

Lunch:
Carmelita's Mexican Grill
4 out of 5 stars from TripAdvisor. Located at 575 Palm Canyon Dr, Borrego Springs, California 92004. Cocktails to go!

Route:
We'll head south on the 15 and exit highway 76. Then catch 79 north to San Felipe (S2) and go south to Montezuma Valley Rd. The one way distance is 104 miles. Let's ride!

events.name: Social distancing at highway speed!!!
events.organiser: Greater Seattle and Puget Sound Motorcycle Riders Meetup
events.description_html:
Let’s take a tour through some small towns , visit the Oso memorial and see some very scenic roads!!!
Weather looks amazing. So let’s ride!!!

RIDERS:

• Please help the host plan the ride by asking questions

• PLEASE BE ON TIME. If you are late, please communicate with the host via text or call.

• If you need to cancel, let the host know by calling/texting them

• Make a back-up plan for returning from the event in case your ride breaks down or a rider is injured. Please post your cell phone and use text messages / phone calls to communicate.

SAFETY:
• EACH MEMBER is responsible for their own safety

• Motorcycle riding is a dangerous activity and can result in death or serious injury

• Know your skill level and be realistic. If you are uncertain, ASK QUESTIONS to more experienced Members before departure. By RSVPing for this ride, you are assuming responsibility for yourself and hold the group organizers, host and Meetup.com harmless for any liability.

• No show-boating, wheelies, burn-outs or other reckless riding. If a member does this, please report it immediately to the event host or one of the organizers. Stupidity is one of the main reasons people get hurt!

• Drinking & riding don't mix! If you're breaking bread with the group, limit your alcohol consumption to legal limits or below! While alcohol "gladdens the heart of man", don't make it your re-hydration method or meals! You won't be very glad if you cause an accident or get a DUI!!

• Safety gear & clothing is always recommended. Bring layers in case the weather is too cool or too warm. Ride safe and responsibly!

events.name: Our Most Important Defense Against COVID-19: Hope through Scientific Evidence
events.description_html:
Welcome to the Global 10-Day Jumpstart to Flatten the Curve through Nutrition!

The Global Jumpstart is aimed at helping people strengthen their immune systems to fight the COVID-19 pandemic through a diet of whole, plant-based foods (vegetables, fruits, whole grain cereals, legumes, nuts, and seeds). According to a newly released commentary by well-known nutrition researcher Dr. T. Colin Campbell, “consuming this diet does not mean we won’t get infected by the virus, but it should increase our defenses to avoid the worst effects from the infection.”

The Global Jumpstart will introduce people to the power of a plant-based diet using a seminar, cooking classes, daily emails, webinars, and other resources, all provided free of charge! The Jumpstart will kick off on Sunday, April 19th.

Sign up now and we’ll be in touch soon with more details.

https://plantpurecommunities.org/global-jumpstart/

events.name: Communicating Across the Political Divide
events.description_html:
Groveland Unitarian Universalist Fellowship invites you to our live online service and program presentation via ZOOM that starts promptly at 10:00 a.m. on Sunday, April 19, 2020. The link to ZOOM will be available to all who RSVP.

Our program topic for this day will be "Communicating Across the Political Divide."

Our speaker, Dr. Yvette Erasmus (photo above), will focus on the question of how do we stay connected and engaged with people who hold diametrically opposed views to our own. To answer this question, she will identify people’s barriers to openness and what to do about them. She will explore the three key stages of a productive dialogue, the importance of a connection mindset, practical tools to build trust and connection with others, and imagine the possibility of coming together over key issues that affect us all

Dr. Yvette Erasmus, PsyD, LP is a global citizen, clinical psychologist, writer, teacher. Her work focuses on helping people bridge gaps internally, between heart, head, gut and soul, and externally, between intentions and actual impact.

A virtual social hour follows the service. Bring your own real coffee if your wish.

This event is free and open to the public. Donations are most welcome and may be mailed to : Groveland UU Fellowship, P.O. Box 40011, Saint Paul, MN[masked].

events.name: Monthly Rice Packing at Lotus Light
events.description_html:
Founded in 1993 by Buddhist monk Grand master Lu, the “Lotus Light Charity Society” (LLCS) is an international non-denominational charitable organization with at least 90 chapters around the world. The primary goal of the society is to ‘benefit all people’ — meaning to improve and enhance the quality of lives of people. The society is opened to ALL, regardless of race, gender, age, creed, or origin.

They coordinated, and sponsored monthly food and ration distribution to over 400 needy families and elderly. Thanks to generous sponsors, the needy clients we serve are receiving, eggs, bread, daily necessities, rice, to supplement their livelihood.

Once a month, on the last Sunday of the month, Volunteers are needed to help prepare and pack rice & beans according to the different zones.

Please RSVP responsibly (read: RSVP only when you can make it) as this will allows others to give their support. (Read: the more hands will make workload lighter)

Check out more photos at our facebook page: Lotus Light Facebook Page (https://www.facebook.com/sglotuslight/)

Cheers!

How to go there from AMK Hub? Take bus 22

Photos Credit: Google & CIA - Carol

Sundays April 12 – May 10 10:30am – 11:45am

Having woken up to our world looking quite different, what can we do now? Buddhist meditation teachings and practices help us to develop more space in ourself giving us flexibility of mind, from which we can make better choices about how to respond in these challenging times.

We will be serving lunch from 11:00 - 1:00 at the Salvation Army Carr P. Collins Social Service Center (across the street from Parkland Hospital). This location prepares and serves 1200 - 1400 meals daily and houses[masked] individuals in four residential programs: Substance Abuse for Men & Women; Homeless Shelter for Men; Homeless Shelter for Women & Children and Domestic Violence Shelter. For more info about SA, please go to http://www.salvationarmydfw.org/

We understand that things happen, so please update your RSVP as soon as possible if your plans change. We need to allow time for others to sign up who may be interested. As of 1/1/2019 if you have more than 2 no shows, you will need to contact one of the host prior to making your RSVP.

IF THIS IS YOUR FIRST TIME: Before you come to this event, please read the "Salvation Army Dress Code" in the Random Acts' "Files" section. http://files.meetup.com/482512/Salvation%20Army%20Dress%20Code%202011.pdf . Please plan to arrive no later than 11:10 for a brief orientation!! Wear a ball cap if you don't want to wear a hair net, however your hair must be tied back.

Parking is behind their building off of Redfield between Lofland and Butler. There is a sign that indicates the parking lot is permit only but park there anyway! Once you turn into that lot you will see the guest parking. Do not park in front of the building as cars will be towed.

events.name: Organizational Meeting (on Zoom)
events.description_html:
I'm really excited about this group. Please bring your ideas to this meeting. Maybe think about the kind of tinctures you'd like to have in your medicine cabinet. Anything from allergy remedies to antivirals. Then after you have that long list, whittle it down to one or two. (It might be a good idea to start simple.) Finally, look into the plants you will need for your remedy. This doesn't have to be well researched. Just a start.

During this meeting, we could create a structure. We could start by introducing ourselves and saying why we were inspired to join the group. Further meetings could be along these lines:

Soil and Seeds
How To Build Growing Boxes (lots of gophers where I live)
Laying Out Your Garden
Discussion on Specific or Common Medicinal Herbs
Making Tinctures

Maybe each one of us takes a medicinal herb, does research and reports back to the group. We all get educated that way and in this time of social distancing, it would be nice to create conversations around this.

I'm thinking of limiting this group to 10 people. I'd like to create rich dialogue and too many people might prevent this. I imagine it will be an ongoing group (weekly??) through the growing seasons. Please join if you are serious about creating a garden and making medicine. Once you join, I will give you the password necessary to get into the Zoom meeting.

events.name: How to Have More Fun by Flying Less
events.description_html:
Could you take a year off flying? In celebration of Earth Day on 22 April, Sunday Assembly invites you to think about your impact on the environment and what changes you can make to slow down the affects of climate change. One of the biggest contributors to our carbon footprint is commercial air travel. A published author of three books about her cycling adventures, lifelong cyclist and environmentalist Anna Hughes talks to us about Flight Free UK, a campaign she started in 2019. Flight Free UK asks people to take a year off flying for the sake of the environment.

And we welcome Bellatrix, a singer and songwriter who also happens to be a Guildhall-trained double bassist and world beatboxing champion. This unusual and multifaceted artist is always engaged in a diverse range of projects for which she wears a multitude of different musical hats.

Sunday Assembly aims to inspire a sense of community with sing-along pop and rock tunes, an energetic host, and a member of the community coming up to tell us how they’re “trying their best”. Please stay after for tea, biscuits, and lively conversation with other members of the community using Zoom’s Breakout Rooms feature. Everyone is welcome.

Register for the event by following this link:
https://zoom.us/meeting/register/uZcldOiuqzIjKjwPf-mFCmoEH2JZt5yiNg

events.name: I-Opener Dance ONLINE :: Boston/Western Mass (Register for Event Link)
events.organiser: I-Opener Ecstatic Dance & Flow Cacao Journeys :: Community :
events.description_html:
"My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style. " - Maya Angelou

I-Opener Dance keeps helping us to stay connected each Sunday morning. Apart, yet together we meet weekly to boost our immune systems, recalibrate and cheer each other up. We ground, we dance, we exchange words of encouragement.

Take this opportunity to gather your energy and to glance at our dance community, not just surviving, but thriving! We start with grounding meditation, get energized by a guided warm up with Jen Earls and move into a DJ'ed ecstatic dance wave - with DJ's Luminus & Journey Weaver.

Open your 👁s, dance with friends, and get your weekly dose of bliss!

===== Event Info =====

10:00 Arrival & Centering
10:05 Opening Circle & Guided Warmup w/ Jen Earls
10:30 DJ'd Ecstatic Dance w/Luminus & Journey Weaver
12:15 Closing Connections

You may participate in the dance or just enjoy witnessing. We have folks from all around the world tuning in! Please be respectful of others... honor yourself, honor each other, and honor the space we are holding for all to enjoy!

===== Logistics ======

☮️ In an effort to create safer spaces for our community:

(1) ***** Register for Event *****
**** unless you have registered with us before ****
https://www.iopenerdance.com/online-event-registration

(2) Event Zoom link will be emailed to you for this & future I-Opener events... you'll only need to register once 😊
(3) Log in to arrive into the "waiting room" then be invited in
(4) Please turn your VIDEO "ON" ... if you wish to dance unseen simply dance out of camera view

** Arrive on time and enjoy our I-Opener slideshow... as space is limited to 100 participants at a time. Registration closes 30 minutes prior to event. **

💜 Feel free to share the registration invitation/link with friends you wish to connect and dance with!! 💜

✴️ Facebook Live Streaming: If registration is closed or the "dance floor" is full... catch the event live at https://www.facebook.com/events/239266730790765/
... in the event and keep trying to log in as participants flow through.

❇️ Zoom Tips:
~ for fullest sound listen using bluetooth earbuds
~ be sure to "name yourself" with your full name
~ click on "gallery view" to see many windows of friends
~ click the box symbol (full screen) to see up to 49 windows at a time
~ use facebook messenger or txt a friend you see to "pin" each other for a dance duet

💟 Suggested donation: $ 8 - $15

** a portion of each weekly virtual dance goes to a local charity in need.. your financial contribution helps to cover I-Opener expenses and support a good cause ***

Venmo: @journeyweaver ("Ecstatic Dance")
Paypal: [masked]
or contact Sarah Monette for alternative payment

We understand that many of us can be experiencing financial hardship in these times. Please don't let finances get in the way of attending, get in touch with us about exchanges for promotional and other help. ( contact I-Opener Dance )

✳️ Guidelines:
~ our events are all ages, races, identities, and spiritual beliefs
~ please be respectful of each other and the space we hold
~ any inappropriate behavior or imagery will result in removal from the meeting without reentry to I-Opener events

** We take the safety or our dance spaces very seriously, any concerns please message I-Opener Dance ***

==== Stay Connected ====

Follow our page I-Opener Dance
Join our group I-Opener Dance Community
Listen to our music on Spotify as "I-Opener Ecstatic Dance"

Visit our website & join our email list: www.iopenerdance.com
