events.description_html:
Sunday Sweat Your Prayers Sacramento is socially distancing and spiritually connecting. Wednesday and Sunday classes are now offered on line. Best way to move with us is to go to the event page on FB Dance Sacramento 5Rhythms: https://www.facebook.com/pg/Sacramento5Rhythms/events/?ref=page_internal

Vibrant community. Yearn to belong ? Want to be part of a dancing congregation, deepening week by week? Looking for somewhere to pause, check in with yourself, connect to like-hearted souls and let it all go? Long to set your spirit free?

Come dance with us:
to the beat of incredible music…
on a great old wood floor…
in the company of a fabulous bunch of people…

Where? Clara Center Auditorium[masked]th Street btwn N & O
New to 5Rhythms?
Intro card $40: 3 admits any Wednesday or Sunday
Single class drop in: $20
10 class card: $175
More info: http://bodyjoy.net/sweat-your-prayers/
Rotating facilitation; check calendar: http://bodyjoy.net/classes/

ABOUT THE 5RHYTHMS®Created by Gabrielle Roth and practiced by tens of thousands worldwide, 5Rhythms® is a philosophy, perspective, performance art and a dynamic movement practice rooted in the principle that if you put the psyche in motion it will heal itself. Movement is both the medicine and the metaphor, reaching across all languages, cultures and age groups to transform suffering into art, art into awareness, and awareness into action. Where the 5Rhythms are practiced, a community is born to dance, to sweat, to change, to support, and to provide a safe place for each of us to shatter the ego's hold and awaken the juicy, unpredictable, fascinating, edge-walking, rock star part of ourselves that yearns to be free.
Late Arrivals: Door on 24th Street will be locked 10:40am Sunday. Entrance to back door is through parking lot.

What happens in Sunday Sweat Your Prayers?

Sweat Your Prayers is minimally guided deep dive, a musical journey into the wisdom of your unique body, tender heart and intuitive mind. Free form dance traverses the territory of our searching soul, our wild and untamed spirit. And, in the same moments, connects us with other spirits, indeed, unites us with all life. 5Rhythms is a moving meditation, profound medicine and a map into this “unexplored wilderness”. Each rhythm – flowing, staccato, chaos, lyrical, stillness – is a gateway map to deep healing.

“Maps are only maps; it’s up to you to take the journey”

~ Gabrielle Roth

So come! Every one is welcome, this is a come-as-you-are party, a safe place to express whatever truth emerges.…all ages, all fitness levels, all shapes and sizes. There are no steps to learn, no possible way to get it wrong. Just bring your beautiful body and willingness to move. Every journey starts with the first step. Why not dance it?

Each session held in meditative silence by Bella or a visiting 5Rhythms instructor. Check the calendar page to find out who is facilitating.

Come as if your life depended on it… "

events.name: Great Art Can Inspire Us in Difficult Times
events.description_html:
This is a one-time presentation for UUUF Inquiring Minds, Plato's Cave, and Orlando Stoics. We are meeting ONLINE (Zoom info is below).

Something different for this Sunday! Ellen Hurwitz and StoicDan will present Dostoevsky's short story "Nine Letters". Two men write a series of letters to each other, hoping to address a business matter. However, their disagreements grow as their correspondence progresses. This is a story about deception and miscommunication, so read carefully! The plot will thicken... it is not what you think... you will be surprised at the end!

For our discussion on Sunday, we've prepared some questions (see below). We can also compare the rising tension in the story to the rising tension in the Coronavirus pandemic.

Suffering is also a key element in Dostoyevsky's work. This story was supposedly written in one night in 1847, when the author was desperate for money. It was later published in 1963. Please join us on this adventure in storytelling with Ellen and StoicDan. Great art can inspire us in difficult times.

As usual, I'll prepare an outline of discussion points for the meeting, so you don't need to read in advance.

Reading material:

Review of Story - https://poettreeyr.wordpress.com/2018/07/17/july-9th-fyodor-dostoevski-a-novel-in-nine-letters-the-epistolary-pov-or-how-we-talk-at-each-other/

Download the Story as a PDF - https://bit.ly/3bYfiyQ

Dostoevsky Biography - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fyodor_Dostoevsky

Questions:

Questions to ponder about the story itself:
1. Why do you think Dostoevsky claims that this short story is a novel?
2. Why do you think he uses letters to tell his tale?
3. Why does he claim that experiences can be misleading and that “a snake sometimes lies hidden under flowers"?
4. Why does he say that friendly relations are deceptive and “mean deceit, treachery, forgetfulness of human duties and proprieties, contrary to the law of God and vicious in every way”?
5. What did you think about the intricate story and the way that it ends?

Questions to ponder about the story’s implications for our own age:
1. Can communication through letters be as conducive to misunderstanding in our day as it was in mid-nineteenth century Russia?
2. Are there any contemporary snakes hidden under flowers crawling around in our own culture?
3. How distracting can a work of art be from the difficult circumstances in which we find ourselves?
4. Do you have favorite writers to whom you are returning during the quarantine?
5. Does the difference in social status between Peter and Ivan remind you of any contemporary social tensions?6. Have you been exposed to significant deceptions and how has this experience affected your life?

CLICK TO START MEETING - https://us04web.zoom.us/j/95396698577

The meeting time is 9AM Eastern, 8AM Central.

If you don't have a computer with camera or mic, then you can attend by telephone. Dial one of these numbers and add meeting ID[masked] #
[masked] US (Chicago)
[masked] US (New York)
[masked] US (Houston)
[masked] US (San Jose)
[masked] US
[masked] US

Our group enjoys open-minded, respectful conversations. If we differ in our opinions, then "we agree to disagree". The long-term goal is to improve our minds via group discussions.

This meeting is free and open to the public.

Weekly reading will be:
Read the 18th chapter and do the exercise every night for a week.

We will also start to go through A Handbook for New Stoics by Massimo Pigliucci and Gregory Lopez found here https://www.amazon.com/Handbook-New-Stoics-Week-Week/dp/1615195335
This book has 52 weeks of Stoic Practices that will allow us to put to use the theory we talk about in the meetup. Grab a copy and join in the Stoic Joy.

General: We will discuss Stoic Philosophy in general, I will present a few Stoic practices that can be directly employed in your life in order to reach a little more equanimity in this crazy world and discuss specific reading that are encouraged but not necessarily required to be read.

This weekly MeetUp of the MKE Stoic Fellowship is being organized by MKE Stoic Fellowship member, and Graduate of the College of Stoic Philosophers - School of Essential Studies, Dan Hayes.

We are meeting on the internet. I will post a hangouts link in the messages of this meetup just before the meeting for you all to join.

As with all of our events, all are welcome!

events.name: Are you Curious about yourself? Personality Test Free Meetup!
events.description_html:
Unique Opportunity to know the REAL YOU!

TAKE THE MOST ACCURATE AND RELIABLE PERSONALITY TEST

No other personality test and analysis gives you both results and practical solutions.

You can be more competent, successful and happier than you ever thought possible, once you identify the key areas of your personality. By discovering which traits are currently benefitting your life and which ones need improvement, you can then take the essential steps to enhance your strengths and overcome your weaknesses.

Plus the OCA and follow up consultation are a FREE public service with no further obligation required.

GET TO KNOW THE REAL YOU

Most of our lives we have been taught to believe that personality is a genetic trait that cannot be changed, and that you just have to deal with it. This simply is not true. The fact is, you can change your personality and become a much better, happier version of yourself that faces and conquers the challenges of life with knowledge and ease the real you.

Find your problem areas and discover your level of happiness, self-confidence, stability and more.
Find out how your personality determines your ability to handle relationships.
Know your strengths and how to increase them so that you can achieve more out of life.

Step 1: TAKE THE TEST
The Oxford Capacity Analysis (OCA) identifies the 10 vital personality traits that influence your entire future. It is a factual, scientific analysis taken from your answers. It is your opinion of you. It takes about an hour to complete.

Step 2: GET YOUR RESULT
After you complete the test, your personality analysis is generated and displayed. This takes less than a minute. It shows your strengths and weaknesses-which personality traits to take advantage of and which to get help with.

Step 3: CONSULTATION
While the analysis graph shows distinct personality traits, it is the interrelationship of these traits that provide the greater picture of your personality. We, therefore, provide a complimentary consultation to give you a detailed evaluation of your personality analysis. One of our trained consultants delivers this to you. In this one-on-one interview, you gain a better understanding of your personality strengths and perceived weaknesses and establish the recommended path to your fast and lasting success.

FREE entry, Free Parking.

This free Personality Test is open to all people of goodwill and is held at the Scientology Delhi Center. Our meetup contain knowledge that is universal and apply to all the worlds people. They contain TOOLS for life.

Join Our Whatsapp Group to get updates regarding upcoming Meetups here: https://chat.whatsapp.com/invite/JQlGeNODYeT4LFVEoqpRPu

events.name: How the Conic Crisis is likely to spread - Manthan with Vivek Kaul
events.description_html:
Note: THIS IS AN ONLINE MEETING
Register at https://bit.ly/2VuQZSt

**THE TALK**
Why the economic pain unleashed by the Conic (Covid-19 Economic) crisis won't end post May 4 and what people can do to be a little prepared to face the troubles ahead. Vivek Kaul will explain.

He shall also address questions on personal finance from the audience.

**VIVEK KAUL**
Vivek Kaul is one of India’s foremost and the most popular commentators on economics and finance. He is renowned to explain highly complex things in simple, easy-to-understand terms.

Vivek Kaul has worked at senior positions with the Daily News and Analysis (DNA) and The Economic Times, in the past. He is a commentator on the Indian economy and currently his writing appears regularly in the Mint, BBC, Dainik Jagran, Newslaundry and Bangalore Mirror.

He is also the author of five books. His fifth book Bad Money—Inside the NPA Mess and How It Threatens the Indian Banking System, was scheduled to be published on April 13, 2020. The release has been postponed due to the lockdown to prevent spread of the corona virus disease.

India’s Big Government—The Intrusive State and How It Is Hurting Us, his fourth book, was published in January 2017.

He is also the author of the Easy Money trilogy, a series of three books on the history of money and banking, and how that caused the financial crisis that started in 2008 and is still on. The books were re-published by HarperCollins, in May 2018, having first been published between 2013 and 2015.

The Hindu had this to say about Kaul and Easy Money: “This indigenous writer has written a book which is truly global in every sense. [We] would take the liberty of placing him in the same league as a Niall Ferguson or a Peter Bernstein, even though this is Vivek Kaul's first book.”

Al Ries, globally respected author and marketing consultant had this to say about Easy Money: “Forget what you think you know about money and read the true, absorbing tale told by Vivek. Kaul in his thorough, but fascinating book, Easy Money. A great read.”

Other than this, he has appeared as an expert on the BBC, Mirror Now, CNBC Awaaz and NDTV India. He speaks regularly on economics and finance and has lectured at IIM Bangalore, IIM Indore, IIM Kozhikode, IIM Vishakhapatnam, NMIMS, SIMSREE, TAPMI and the Symbiosis Institute of Media and Communication, among others, in the past.

Schedule:
• 10.30 am – Talk
• 11.15 am – manthan (discussion)

events.name: Adapting to a Post Covid-19 Business World
events.organiser: Network with Fashion Industry Professionals & Recruiters
events.description_html:
This is a webinar dedicated to hearing insight about adapting to a new world of business as a result of Covid-19. Our presenter, Kevin Williams, comes from an industry which might be possibly the most negatively affected by the Covid-19, Out-of-Home Entertainment. Kevin will discuss topics that pertain to multiple industries using his expertise on consumer behavior. While discussing lessons in history from previous "Black Swan" events.

MUST RSVP HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/adapting-to-a-post-covid-19-business-world-by-kevin-williams-tickets-102524950888 and you will get Zoom link on confirmation email

Topics/Main-points:
- Lessons on the impact Covid-19 has had on theme parks and leisure entertainment in China

- The new normal of out-of-home entertainment as China slowly reopens

- Lessons learned and borrowed from 2008 financial crisis as it pertains to the "Black Swan" of 2020.

- Short term solutions being used in today's business climate, and how it might impact negatively/positively business in the future.

About the Speaker:
Kevin Williams – a leading specialist in the digital Out-of-Home entertainment industry, through his consultancy KWP Limited, specializing in interactive entertainment. Coming from a long career in the theme park, amusement and entertainment software industries. Well known for his news service, The Stinger Report that has become a-must-read for those working or investing in the international market. Along with this, he is also a prolific writer with regular columns for the main trade publications in this market, along with presenting numerous conference sessions on the sector and its global impact. He is also the co-author of the only book on this aspect of the market, “The Out-of-Home Immersive Entertainment Frontier” – currently working on the next edition for 2021, scheduled for publication soon. Kevin can be reached at [masked].

events.name: Diversity and Inclusion in Fashion (Online Meetup)
events.description_html:
There’s no denying that, in its long and prominent history, the fashion industry has more often than not represented one standard of beauty. From catwalks to advertising campaigns, brands in days past have typically veered towards models of a typical build, age, and ethnicity – but we all know the world is a much richer tapestry. However, in recent years, the industry has been doing more to champion diversity, and we are seeing a much more inclusive approach to representation.

In the previous AFA Fashion Talk we discussed about how Covid-19 will influence Fashion Digital Marketing. During this new online Meetup, we will explore Diversity and Inclusion in Fashion through four talks. As usual, we will start with the presentations by senior students of their academic researches and we will end with the talk by an expert.

1. "The influences of Fashion Trends on Gender Roles", by Sabrina Marinus, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

2. "Cultural Appropriation and Fashion", by Gabriella Frempong, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

3. "Gender Neutral Fashion, Is There a Future?", by Quirine Galavazi, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

4. "Perspectives on Diversities and Inclusions in the Fashion Industry", by Giancarlo Pazzanese, lecturer of the Amsterdam Fashion Academy.

At the end of the four talks, you will have the opportunity to ask questions to the panelists.

Please, click on the link to register: https://luiss.webex.com/luiss/onstage/g.php?MTID=e017282e03b498828e710cbb1cc96c5ba

This Online Meetup has no costs. Feel free to invite guests!

events.name: Stash busting sewalong, step 4: sewing up!
events.description_html:
If you're still with me on using a stash fabric or just want general support of your current sewing project here's the last part of this sewlong: sew it up!

If you finished your item long ago, how about making another one? The more of our stash fabrics we get through, the more experience we gain and the more satisfying the sewing process can become.

I must admit that I have not yet started the navy/cream velvet top I want to make - and that's because I am not sure that I picked a suitable pattern. I did start a sleeveless blouse with a different stash fabric (nothing to do with the velvet project just because I got the sudden urge). And I started a toile out of a newly bought and very cheap black jersey so I can evaluate the Lekala pattern I was going to use for my precious velvet. I also used a grey jersey fabric from my stash for a simple raglan sleeved top and now wonder if that mightn't be the best pattern for the velvet?

Every practical bit that I get to do teaches me what works and what doesn't. Unfortunately I often stop at the stage of "oh crikey I've run into a problem" and never picked the project back up. That gets very frustrating. It makes such a nice change this time: I threw myself into sewing with any fabric and any pattern that mysteriously made its way onto my sewing table. I will tackle the velvet, I promise!

What are you making, what kinds of stash fabric have you used recently and which do you think you might use next? Pictures please!

events.organiser: San Diego Triathlon Series Free Training Clinics & Events
events.description_html:
FREE Triathlon Training
The San Diego Triathlon Series 2020 Kick-Off Party Training Clinics
At Bonita Cove in Mission Bay

Special Guests - Training Talks - Transition Clinics and FREE BBQ
XTERRA WETSUITS will be at the kick-off so you can try on and buy wetsuits. Great deals
Pulse Endurance Sports will be at the kick-off with their mechanic to help you with your bicycle.

Free Transition Clinic, Run clinic / 4K Run, Tire Changing Clinic, Swim Clinic, Tire Changing Clinic, Nutrition for racing, Triathlon 101 Class

Whether you are New to Triathlons or a Pro
We have beginner to Advanced Training Programs.
Fun and Free Meet Up Training Groups all around San Diego County
Kids Triathlon Programs
Schedule:
7:00 to 7:15 am Check-in for Transition Clinic
7:30 am Transition Clinic (Beginner and Advanced tract)
- Rehab United - Learn to make faster transition from the SwimSwim to the Bike, and the Bike to the run (great for both beginners to experienced Triathletes.)

9:00 TWO Clinics Offered
9:00 am Swim Clinic By Bryan Mineo - The Swim Mechanic
or
9:00 am Bike Clinic with Darrell Steele, League Certified Bike Instructor & TCSD Bike Leader - Learn how not just to race fast, but also safe: mount, dismount, passing, drafting, and much more. Bring your bike and bike gear: helmet, shoes, etc. (great for beginners to experienced triathletes)

10:00 am TWO clinics based on your experience level
Option 1 - Triathlon 101 - The basics of Triathlon - What you need to know the get started in Triathlon
Option 2 - Planning your 2020 Triathlon Training Schedule and Nutrition with UCAN.

11:00 am - 2 Options to Choose From-
11:00 am Triathlon Training Run Clinic and 4K Run - fast, medium, slow, and walk groups.
or
11:00 am Tire Changing Clinic Hosted by Brian Lewis

Noon - BBQ Picnic

Please RSVP for this Free event, so we know how many bike racks to bring out and have enough food for all - Please and bring your friends.

Note on the - Transition Clinic starts at 7:30 am - (check-in 7 am to 7:15 am) Learn how to Transition from the Swim to the Bike To the Run. Great for Beginners and seasoned Triathletes. Bryan Hill from Rehab United has helped Our SD Tri Series Athletes to take valuable time off transitions and learn tricks to just do it all better. Bring everything you need to Swim / Bike / Run.

What to Bring
Please bring the following for these Clinics:
Swim (Wetsuit - if you have one), goggles, swim cap, body glide, towel - swimsuit or tri-suit, wear what you will wear in the race)

Bike (Bike-yep you need it, helmet required, bike shoes, sunglasses)

Run (running shoes preferably with easy laces, race belt/number if you have an old one, hat/visor)

Please bring nutrition (water bottle + nutrition) UCAN will be onsite to let you try their nutrition products that will be on the courses at all 2020 Triathlons

Note on bikes and other equipment: As mentioned above, please bring a bike, this can be any kind of Bike. Road bikes are preferred for triathlons, but many people use mountain or hybrid bikes. Make sure you check your tires have air. If you are looking for a bike or need to have a tune-up, please call or stop into Pulse Endurance Bikes. Tell them KOZ sent you.
The San Diego Triathlon Series 2020 includes the Following Events
The Xterra Wetsuits Spring Sprint Triathlon - May 2-3, 2020
The San Diego International Triathlon - June 28, 2020
The Solana Beach Triathlon - July 26, 2020
The CVC Half Triathlon - August 9, 2020
San Diego Triathlon Classic - Rocks the Bay Triathlon - September 12, 2020
The Xterra Wetsuits Mission Bay Triathlon - October 10 - 11, 2020
Information www.SDTriseries.com

Compete in all of the series events to rack up points. We have age groups for Men, Women, Kids, Athena, and Clydesdales. Earn the Triple Crown of Triathlon Award by Participating in the 2020 Xterra Spring Sprint, CVC San Diego Half Triathlon, Xterra Mission Bay Triathlon.

💬 MEDIA💬

Scan QR code below to join our Whatsapp Group for last minute updates, pictures and learn more about Fitfam Community!
Follow us on Instagram @fitfam_sg!

🙅 NOT GOING 🙅‍♂️

If you have signed up for a session and can no longer make it, please move yourself to "Not Going" so our leaders have a more accurate count of participants coming to their session. This also helps us plan workouts more effectively.

🔊 DISCLAIMER 🔊

By signing up for this session, you confirm that you have read and understood the terms and risks detailed in our Disclaimer and Release of Liability Agreement: https://www.meetup.com/FitFamSingapore/pages/29688134/Disclaimer_and_Release_of_Liability/

For any other question regarding our workouts and our community, please refer to the FAQs page: https://www.meetup.com/FitFamSingapore/pages/29688120/FitFam_FAQs/
----

Our workouts are about bringing people together and are based on High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT) using nothing but your own bodyweight strength and conditioning philosophy, which alternates between intense bursts of activity and fixed periods of rest. Think push-ups, squats, jumping lunges, burpees... but more creative and interactive!

FitFam is accessible to everyone. No equipment, no previous experience or wallet needed.

See you out there!

events.name: Run with the Dawgs - PYD
events.description_html: Meet at old guard shack. Run a loop or an out and back.

events.name: Walt's Ride
events.description_html: Enjoy the beautiful spring blooms as we ride up hill and down dale - Some great scenery in the back country of Rancho Mission Viejo off of Los Padrones. The ride is about 30 miles with climbing up La Pata and Antonio. Breakfast at any of the take out places (or grocery store) at the shopping center Ortega & Antonio. They have a nice grass area and some picnic tables where we can spread out and enjoy our brunch.

events.name: *****Run @ Alameda Creek *****
events.description_html:
Hi Folks,

Hope all of you are doing well. We'll run at Bay View trail, Foster City. This gorgeous trail sits right along side Bay. Total distance that we'll run is around 5-7 miles. Even if you plan to run shorter distance, please feel free to join us.

P.S: We'll start warm up at around 7.45 am and within a few minutes will start our run.

Cheers,
Raj

events.name: Sunday AM Carson Run
events.description_html:
Want to learn more about the Colorado Columbines Women's Running Club and what we’re all about? Join the group for a no-strings-attached hour-long run (or walk, depending on your fitness level) on the Platte River Trail (http://www.traillink.com/trail/platte-river-trail.aspx) (also known as the Mary Carter Greenway Trail)! (Note that RSVPs here on Meetup don't reflect our actual numbers; 15-20+ women run/walk every single week, year-round! Our club communications happen primarily through the members-only message board.) Also, leashed dogs and baby strollers are welcome, as well as any pace! There are no 'bad' runners. :)

Get all the details here: https://www.columbinesrunning.org/about/sunday-morning-runs/

After the run, we hope you will consider joining the Colorado Columbines Women's Running Club, for just $35 per year. Still have questions? Message Heather!

events.name: Sunday Funday
events.organiser: Blazing Paddles - Mission:Jupiter dragon boat racing Meetup
events.description_html:
NOTE THAT AS OF 23 MARCH DUE TO THE PANDEMIC MOST PRACTICES WILL TAKE PLACE IN CANOES. IF WE ARE ABLE TO PRACTICE IN A DRAGON BOAT WE WILL IMPLEMENT PROTOCOLS TO REDUCE RISK.

If you have never gone Dragon Boating before, then the following
YouTube link will be helpful for you to watch before you go:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-IL8bGKKICc&fbclid=IwAR1ZpPMUH9N62u7l_TrJhEqDOhEM3h-L6vjONtbsPjUD1mKPiqoEGAMYmcY

****WEATHER CAN BE AN ISSUE THIS TIME OF YEAR - PLEASE TEXT[masked] FOR STATUS OF MEET-UP***** (You may be referred to another number as a different practice leader is assigned from time to time).

COME TRY IT FOR WITHOUT OBLIGATION!!! Blazing Paddles is a coed paddling team started by Captain Will Murphy in 2000. We have paddlers from Miami to Port St. Lucie. We compete in dragon boat, canoe and other water sports, and members participate in all manner of outdoor adventures. No experience necessary. Just a good attitude, clothes and shoes that can get wet and at least 20 ounces of water or a sports drink in a plastic bottle. Please note that the meet up lasts between 1:15-1:30 minutes. If you have to be back at a certain time, please let us know before we leave.

Note that weather, races and other factors sometimes lead us to change the schedule so ***PLEASE CONFIRM BEFORE YOU COME**. ALSO SEATS ARE LIMITED SO PLEASE TRY TO SHOW UP IF YOU RSVP. ******HAVE FUN AND HOPE TO SEE YOU ON THE DRAGON BOAT*****

For each of your first three practices -- donations accepted but not required. Most participants donate $5-$20 to SOAR, the 501c3 charity that owns the boats.

If you decide you want to join, we will send you the paperwork. Annual dues are $300 but substantial discounts are available for early payment, and many members get credits over the course of the year for helping out.

You can reach us as follows:
Stu - [masked] area code 561 Phone 389 and 0369

Linda -- Area Code 603 Phone 312 and 1653.

Patti - Pelapierre@roadrunner dot com area code 561 Phone 346 and 3690

REMINDERS
1) Call first! We don't want you to make the trip to learn a paddling practice was canceled.
2) Bring shoes that can get wet.
3) Bring cash or access to Venmo or Paypal for donation (accepted, not required; most folks give $5-$20).

events.name: Bike Path Run - Eastwood MetroPark
events.description_html:
Note new location this week (4/4)!

Eastwood MetroPark

Join us for our weekly Sunday Bike Path Run!

These are usually out and back runs on local bike paths. Beavercreek is our go-to bike path but we sometimes switch it up with Yellow Springs, Miamisburg, Moraine, and downtown Dayton along the river.

We usually all start together but the distance and pace will be at your own leisure.

We meet at 8:00am for some stretching and then we start the run promptly at 8:15am.

Note: We have moved the Sunday runs to an 8:00am start.

events.name: (Online) 30min Grab Bag "Game" Workout + Coffee Chat
events.description_html:
Our workouts will be virtual via Skype for the foreseeable future due to the COVID-19 outbreak in our area and in accordance with state and national recommendations.

8:30am-9:00am Workout: 30 minute grab bag "game" workout. I will lead you through a couple of 'games' that will get our hearts pumping.
The workout will be as apartment friendly as possible, but as always - feel free to modify as needed. You will need: a mat/towel, a small space to move around, some water, and a phone/computer with internet connection and Skype account & app.

9:15-10:15am Coffee: This week's coffee conversation topic is - Go on a walk sometime this week prior to the workout and be prepared to tell us about the most interesting thing you encountered on the walk. Maybe it was something beautiful, something funny, something weird. We want to know!

Workout Instructions:
1. Download the (free) Skype app if you haven't already. Create your personal Skype account.
2. Join our Fresh Air Fitness Skype group: https://join.skype.com/SXE10CmQoF6Q
3. Familiarize yourself with how to mute yourself in Skype or via your computer (not your speakers, but your microphone)
4. Log in to skype and navigate to the Fresh Air Fitness group (left hand side of your Skype home screen) at 8:25am and be ready to answer/join the video call that Kelly will initiate.
5. During the video workout, you can have yourself unmuted (if you wish) during the warm up and during any rest periods. But during the actual workout periods you need to mute your microphone to improve everyone's audio experience.

Coffee Instructions:
1. Kelly will host the call from 9:15am until 10:15am (possibly later! but at least until then). To help improve the experience for everyone and make things more engaging, plan to hang with us for roughly 30mins and feel free to stagger when you join/call in at any time during the hour so hopefully make for slightly smaller groups at any given time.
2. You must wear headphones for the coffee chat to help reduce feedback (exception: if you have more than 1 person in your household who is joining the call together).
3. We will be publishing a conversation starter for each coffee chat! This doesn't mean we can't talk about other things, or that covid-talk is off limits, but rather just gives us all something specific to contribute to the conversation. Be sure to check the top of each workout (or our Facebook reminder) for this week's coffee conversation starter.

Looking forward to seeing you!

*Keep up to date with our virtual versus in person decision making and other updates by making sure to allow organizer emails via MeetUp.*

events.name: Catch Me At Claddagh (CMAC) Irish Pub 9 AM Sundays to Run/Walk
events.organiser: Catch Me At Claddagh - Running & Race Walking Meetup
events.description_html:
Charities Challenge "Catch Me At Claddagh" open small group Training Times gathers Sunday mornings @ 9 AM in the parking lot behind The Claddagh Irish Pub & Restaurant - Maple Grove.

Temporarily limiting RSVPs to 10.

So, please do not RSVP if you're not truly going to show up to run or walk with our happy-hearty-healthy group.

Note: Claddagh was closed to the public as of St Patrick's Day, March 17, consistent with the Coronavirus orders of the State of MN and will reopen within several weeks when those orders are updated
http://www.claddaghirishpubs.com/maple-grove/

Optional marked certified distances for training include: mile, two miles, 5k to run or race walk on our USATF certified course. Of course, you can run farther anytime, too.

If you need a restroom before or after our Training Times, I recommend dropping into the Lund'sByerly's just a couple blocks south of Claddagh after 8 AM. While there you might also pick up a snack and beverage for refueling after your training time together. I'll bring a thermos of coffee to share, and usually a yogurt and scone for myself. Bring anything to share, too.

If you start earlier or later, come into the restaurant when you've finished training and find other CMAC runners and walkers already around the Arbor Lake or in the parking lot. We'll record our own times and report them as part of our ongoing CC Training Times. No entry fee!

I do recommend joining CC for an annual $25 membership thereby getting lots of added values; but, CC membership is not required. http://www.charitieschallenge.org/html/cc_membership.html

Please RSVP with CC Coach [masked] or[masked] and tell your family/friends to e-mail their RSVP for “Catch Me At Claddagh” so I may look for every one of you Sunday mornings. What a good time, and a recorded time, we'll each and all have together. Learn to invite others by saying, "Catch Me At Claddagh".

events.name: Book Club and 5km Run Virtual Meetup
events.description_html:
MVARC once again will host our monthly easy run, perfect for beginners and slower runners, followed by book discussion. The book for April is the novel A Long Petal of the Sea by Isabel Allende. According to USA Today, " Isabel Allende’s A Long Petal of the Sea gets to the heart of immigrant struggle. . . . [It] begins, as it ends, with the heart. . . . Allende’s prose is both commanding and comforting. The author writes eloquently on the struggle of letting go of one culture to embrace a new one and shows that one’s origin story is not the whole story. . . . While debate and policy surround the issues of refugees and immigration, Allende reminds us that these issues, at their core, are made up of individuals and their love.“

This month’s meeting needs to be a virtual meeting due to the COVID-19 Pandemic. Please run on your own starting at 9 am, or frankly anytime. We’ll tag up online at for book discussion at 10.

events.name: Free Anytime Online Repeat - 4 Ways to Be Happy for No Reason (Yes, Even Now!)
events.organiser: Art Galleries And Exhibitions In Bristol & Bath
events.description_html:
Free Anytime Online Repeat - 4 Ways to Be Happy for No Reason (Yes, Even Now!)

Location: Online via Zoom from your computer, telephone or mobile device
Cost: Completely free for everyone! Please share the registration link with your friends, family, and community: https://certifiedhappinesstraining.com/happy-for-no-reason-replay/?inf_contact_key=c670f093e2c09fefb0f8fa71e879bf687e470d92b8b75168d98a0b8cac0e9c09

"During this video gathering, we’ll offer 4 practical tools including:
How to transform fear into peace and ease
Choosing wisdom over worry -- stopping the downward spiral of your thoughts
Quick practices to overcome the blahs and raise your energy and vibrancy
How to give to family, friends or those in need without forgetting about yourself (or without feeling depleted)"

Marci: "How are you doing these days?
Many people I’m talking with say it feels like they’re on an emotional roller coaster ride every single day. Luckily for some there are still some beautiful highs. But what do we do about the lows and the downright scariness of the ride… especially now?

First of all, it helps to acknowledge the truth.
Yes, our sense of well-being is getting tested daily (perhaps even hourly if you suddenly find yourself home-schooling your children)! Now more than ever, it’s important to have the ability to easily access your sense of inner peace and balance.

Last week, I offered a free class (along with Kim Forcina) on The Power of Happiness During These Challenging Times. Thousands of people joined us and the feedback we’ve received from that session is awe-inspiring.

So we decided to offer another FREE LIVE session where we’ll share new practical and effective ways to spark happiness inside of you.

In this online video gathering, we’ll also answer your questions and do some personal coaching. You, your family, friends and community are all welcome to join us for “4 Ways to Be Happy for No Reason (Yes, Even Now!)”

events.name: Global 10 Day Jump Start with Plant Pure Community
events.description_html:
JOIN US on the Global 10-Day Jumpstart to Flatten the Curve through Nutrition!

The Global Jumpstart is aimed at helping people strengthen their immune systems to fight the COVID-19 pandemic through a diet of whole, plant-based foods (vegetables, fruits, whole grain cereals, legumes, nuts, and seeds).

According to a newly released commentary by well-known nutrition researcher Dr. T. Colin Campbell, “consuming this diet does not mean we won’t get infected by the virus, but it should increase our defenses to avoid the worst effects from the infection.”

The Global Jumpstart will introduce people to the power of a plant-based diet using a seminar, cooking classes, daily emails, webinars, and other resources, all provided free of charge!

The Jumpstart will kick off on Sunday, April 19th.

Sign up to learn more.

https://plantpurecommunities.org/global-jumpstart/

events.name: Global 10-Day Jumpstart Program
events.description_html:
Government leaders are talking about physical distancing and testing for COVID-19 as two strategies that will help flatten the curve. Dr. T. Colin Campbell offers a third way -- strengthening our immune systems to fight the COVID-19 pandemic through a diet of whole, plant-based foods (vegetables, fruits, whole grain cereals, legumes and nuts).

https://plantpurecommunities.org/defense-against-covid-19/

According to Dr. Campbell, “consuming this diet does not mean we won’t get infected by the virus, but it should increase our defenses to avoid the worst effects from the infection, and in doing so, help to flatten the curve of hospitalizations.”

Many of us are feeling vulnerable and are looking for things we can do to protect ourselves and our families. So PlantPureCommunities has developed a strategy to communicate Dr. Campbell’s empowering message through a free Global 10-Day Jumpstart Program to Flatten the Curve through Nutrition, commencing April 19th. Here is the link to sign up:

https://plantpurecommunities.org/global-jumpstart/

While the details are still being worked out, there are plans for educational seminars, cooking classes, daily emails and webinars - and it's all free!

For ongoing additional information and to share with others, you can join the Facebook group:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/global.jumpstart/

Please share this information with friends and family!

events.name: Global 10-Day Jumpstart to Flatten the Curve through Nutrition
events.description_html:
Many of us are feeling vulnerable and looking for how we can best protect ourselves and our families from COVID-19. Are you up for a health-promoting challenge this month?

Starting Sunday, April 19, a FREE "Global 10-Day Jumpstart to Flatten the Curve through Nutrition" is being offered. Here's the link to sign up:
plantpurecommunities.org/global-jumpstart.

You'll receive seminars, cooking demonstrations, daily emails, resources, and camaraderie. Whether you're new to plant-based eating or wanting to learn more, here's your chance to be part of this powerful global movement!

events.name: IndieCade & Games For Our Future present CLIMATE JAM
events.description_html:
Our annual in-person Games For Our Future Game Jam may be cancelled but we're excited to be partnering with IndieCade on their inaugural CLIMATE JAM! We're also working with the University of Washington's EarthLab, Take This, IGDA Victoria, IGDA Austin, Pacific Science Center, AIE and more to involve as many game devs and research partners as possible.

We invite developers from across the globe to join, contribute, and virtually connect!

The goals for the jam are to take action and raise solutions. We believe this generation of creators care deeply for our planet and holds the power to inspire while using games as a platform. At this moment it is all the more relevant to think about community, nature, and resilience in the face of global crises. We have this moment to explore how new and different kinds of relationships between people and nature might build the resilience we need to withstand and reverse major global calamities, such as climate change, pandemics, and economic downturns.

CLIMATE JAM is a virtual jam hosted on itch.io: https://itch.io/jam/indiecade-climate-jam

This will be a remote / online jam! We invite developers from across the globe to join, contribute, and virtually connect. The online jam will be covered live over IndieCade social media channels. We invite developers from across the globe to create their own hubs or meetups if they want to jam with their friends. The online jam will be covered live over IndieCade social media channels. Join us on the #climate-jam channel on the IndieCade Discord!

The goals for the jam are to take action and raise solutions. We believe this generation of creators cares deeply for the environment and holds the power to inspire while using games as a platform.

A growing list of sub-themes:

⊖ Going zero waste
⊚ Caring for the earth
⦿ Volunteerism
⊛ Veganism
⦶ Political action
⊖ Buying local
⊚ Transportation choices
⦿ Creating work

A grand-prize winner and runner-ups will be selected upon completion of the jam. Awardees will also receive a price package which includes: Hand made original artwork, Promotion of game and studio/individual, Opportunity to be featured at IndieCade events (US/ EU), and a Carbon offset donation in your studios/individual name

The awards will be announced on Earth Day: April 22, 2020.

This event is made possible by our sponsors at Riot Games and Niantic!

events.name: The Tower of Infinite Sadness - Part 4
events.description_html:
Otus the Omnipotent, former hedge-wizard of High Harbor, now elevated (well, at least in his own mind) to a wizard of serious renown, has absconded with a prized magical artifact to a nearby ruined tower.

Just as he managed to somehow obtain said-artifact by doing nothing more than trailing along with an erstwhile adventuring party from Riverthrow (and contributing very little in the process), thanks to his newly-acquired artifact, he now hopes to do the same with Randrok's Tower.

A long-abandoned stronghold of lore, the tower has seen its share of despots and madmen over the years, hoping to plumb its depths of magical items and treasure. Joining that storied list now is Master Otus himself, but an enterprising band of hobgoblins and bugbears stands in his way, as well as you, hired by the Master Bard himself, Cain Lethellon, tasked to return the artifact to Riverthrow for safekeeping and further study.

Glory and gold and the many treasures that undoubtedly lie within await.... that is, if you return from as the legends call it... the Tower of Infinite Sadness.

** Currently running this module series as a way to get familiar with the Roll 20 platform, will soon open it up for another interested group when it's complete! **

UPDATE: Ok, we've gotten to the point where there are security issues at this event -- we've had games disappear from three different people, myself included. To that end:

1) Always ask when you borrow a game.
2) Get your games back when people borrow them. If you leave before they leave, then the game is over and they have to give it back.
3) If you are the person or people who ended up with these games, please simply return them at the next Meetup.

It's a damn shame that petty theft has entered this space, but it only takes one.

Check out the games we played at the discussion for the previous month's meetup.

Also in the discussion please suggest games and bring any game you want to play to be sure there is a copy available.

events.name: D&D Dyke Night
events.organiser: LGBTQIA+ & ALLIES Dungeons & Dragons RPG Meetup
events.description_html:
PANDEMIC PROTOCOL IN EFFECT: We're playing ONLINE!

We follow the Safe Space Code of Conduct on the ABOUT page of this meetup and use the X-card as a safety tool.

Sometimes we need a defined space to call our own to feel safe in, hence the D&D Dyke Night title for this series. This is a pro-LGBTQIA+ series for both queer players and their queer characters. We are starting at level THREE, then each game we will level up. I suspect we will go 6 to 8 sessions, maybe more if there is interest from the players.

We are using D&D 5th Edition ruleset. Please make a 3rd level character (how about a Butch Paladin, or a non-binary bard tortle?) .

Use standard stat array and average hit points. Any Race or Class from *Official* Wizards of the Coast products is acceptable.

If you need a pre-generated character let Vicster the DM know in the comments.

Level Three Session Story Hook: Spire of the Sun Goddess
The spire was once a most holy site, a beacon for the faithful and a bastion of divine will. The clergy grew proud. Then they grew lax and lazy. Then the tower was overrun by the forces of evil, who took the decadent priesthood by surprise. The deity brought her wrath down upon the invaders, and the tower has been sealed for centuries. The clerics of the Sun Goddess have received visions and omens about the spire. It has been foretold that the faithful may reclaim their lost holy site—if the right representatives are sent to pass tests within the tower and cleanse any remaining taint of evil that may lie within the place.

PLAYING ONLINE, HOW IT WORKS!

We are using our sister meetup, the RPG Alliance's accounts on Roll20 and DISCORD, both are FREE to use.

1) Sign up for a FREE account and then Log into Roll20 (link below), JOIN the game, and once you are IN the game I can assign you a character sheet and you can input your basic data to ease dice rolling. We will spend a few minutes at game start teaching those new to Roll20 some basic functions. **It is really easy, especially if you input your character to the character sheet in roll20**

Roll 20 game link upon request:
https://roll20.net/welcome

2) Then create an free account on DISCORD, log in, and click on this link to join the RPG Alliance server
https://discord.gg/TsTuKk2
Once on the server join the Game 1 Voice Chat.

*** We suggest you do all of this a few days BEFORE GAME DAY, that way if you have any problems you can contact the DM/GM in the comments to help you.***

WHAT YOU NEED:
1) Laptop/Computer

2) A HEADSET WITH A MICROPHONE, or even a iphone earbuds with the mic in it. They range from $18 to whatever you want to spend. Make sure you test your equipment out days before the game please.

https://www.amazon.ca/s?k=computer+headset+microphoe&ref=nb_sb_noss

3) Register for a free account with both ROLL20 and DISCORD. And log into both including LAUNCHING the GAME in Roll20 (then I can set you up in game once you enter it, do this a week before if you can):
https://roll20.net/
https://discord.gg/TsTuKk2

To enter VOICE chat , go to left side of the screen see RPG ALLIANCE, look down , pass Text Channel to VOICE CHANNELS, you will see GENERAL, click on that and your Avatar should appear, try talking and a green light flashes around your avatar when Discord pick up your mic.
Sometimes you have to switch which version of Discord you are signing in with: the Browser or the App, and that will fix the problem, don’t ask me why. Worst case scenario, download Discord on your cell phone and use that.

I have set up a Private Club on line where we can still play together AND practice Social Distancing!!

Club Name (Still Pending PokerStars approval)
LPLB On Line - Club ID#[masked]

Please read all instructions carefully

**If you have already joined our PokerStars Club, you do not need to rejoin again, simply sign up for the tournament and send me your buy in.

**When sending me the buy in, you do not need to put anything in the memo, but if you feel the need to PLEASE JUST PUT THE DATE...I know what its for.

Steps to join the PokerStars club and the tournament:

On a laptop or desktop, download the PokerStars software and create an account https://www.pokerstars.bet/.

Once set up and signed in, look to the bottom right of the screen.
Depending on the size of your screen you will either see ‘Home Games’, OR the word More under the three dots. Click on the word More, and you will see ‘Home Games’
Click on Home Games and a new window will pop-up.

On the left side of the screen click on Join a Poker Club.
A new window will pop-up.
Enter the following Club #, Invitation Code
Club ID#[masked]
Invitation Code: LPLB On Line

**IMPORTANT - Where it asks for your name, you MUST put the email or name I am going to receive your buy in from...I MUST be able to associate your PokerStars screen name with the payment app name/email you are going to use

Click the “I agree to the Terms & Conditions” box, then click “Join Club”.

I’ll get a message to approve you; once I do (I will check regularly for new sign ups), you will then be able to see the club lobby.

**You must go back once approved and register for the tournament..... it is a two step process....joining the club does not automatically enter you in the tournament.

Go to the Cashier (upper right corner of the main PokerStars page) you can add play chips to your account every 4 hours to build your bankroll of play money.

Buy in $25
~ Venmo: @EstherLudwig - Preferred method please
~ Zelle: [masked] - Send me a separate email with your Zelle name, PokerStars screen name and your email address.
~ Paypal: [masked]. If you use Paypal, please select friend to friend/person to person….. DO NOT select goods and services or PayPal will take a fee.

$1 will be reserved from each players buy in to cover the costs of running the club.

events.name: Morning Pleasure / Village.Online
events.organiser: Village.Berlin (Stretch Village e.V. Community for GBTQ men)
events.description_html:
= Village.Online event =

ZOOM Link: https://zoom.us/j/715487196?pwd=K3hEcE0wTEVqUk5ReU1XU0dyd2ZMZz09

Morning Pleasure
with Alexander Hahne & Nino Mar Seliz

Die Einladung zu diesem Workshop geht an alle, die Lust haben sich dem eigenen ganz-körperlichen Selbst zu nähern, Genuss, Erregung und Spürfähigkeit zu erfahren. Durch den kollektiven Rahmen wird es möglich, diese Erfahrungen zu teilen und sich selbst zu erleben. In die Sinne und verschiedenen Zustände eines verkörperten Selbst einzutauchen und sich selbst zu Regulieren Im Mittelpunkt der angeleiteten Übungen stehen: Atem, Stimme, Bewegung und Selbstberührung. Mit welchen wir dann in einem gemeinsamen Raum der verkörperten Selbstliebe / Masturbation eintauchen wollen.
Es ist ein Selbsterfahrungsworkshop für mehr Verbindung zu dir selbst. Es gibt kein Richtig oder Falsch, kein Muss und Performance-Druck! Die Kamera kann dabei natürlich auch ausgestellt werden.

===

Morning Pleasure
mit Nino Mar Seliz

The invitation to this workshop goes to all those who are interested to approach one's own whole-body self, pleasure, excitement and the ability to sense. Through the collective framework we enter those states and the possibility to share these experiences. The senses and various states of an embodied self supports regulation. We focus on the breath, sounds, movement and self-touch. With that inspiration we enter a focused space for yourself to dive into embodied self-love / masturbation as much as you want. It is a self-awareness workshop for more embodied connection to yourself. There is no right or wrong, no need to do anything and no performance pressure! Of course the camera can also be turned off and on, however you want.

===

events.name: Remarkable Men - Soulful Sunday Sessions ( + Brunch )
events.description_html:
Please note that this session will take place on ZOOM. A link will be sent out just before the call to give you access. If you would like to sign up for this can you please send me a private message with a contact e-mail address.

Please note also the start time is 10am.

TAKING CARE OF OUR EMOTIONAL NEEDS:

We meet again on Zoom this Sunday to look at wholehearted ways to meet our emotional needs.

As staying home becomes our new normal; structure and daily routine outside our home seem like a distant memory for most of us; and adjusting to a new rhythm and way of being becomes a daily challenge for the moment, taking care of our emotional needs becomes a priority.

This week we look at 2 really vital needs for these extraordinary times:

: a sense of our own competence and achievements in the things that we do in our lives
: meaning ~ feeling that our lives have purpose and meaning

I hope that you can join us.

This session will take place on line via Zoom and to make it as accessible to as many people as possible I am suggesting payment is by donation rather than the normal fee of £15 (waged) or £10 (unwaged).

Remarkable Men is a facilitated space where a rich, diverse range of Gay men meet to explore a topic that impacts our lives.

Do you want to start Sundays feeling revived + invigorated?
Do you crave a more interesting type of conversation?
Do you want to connect in an open and non judgemental environment?
Do you want to deepen your understanding of yourself?

Certified Life Coach Darren Brady ( Co founder of The Quest for Gay Men + Great Gay Getaways ) and Courage Coach, Jonathan Ward, guide the group in some fascinating conversations.

Now in its 3rd amazing year, this Sunday 'drop in' group lifts the spirit, emboldens and helps connect Gay men.

Anyone who is curious, open and committed to their self development is welcome to try out this group.

Curiosity, life experience, openness, honesty and warmth!

• Important to know
Payment is by donation and can be made via Paypal.

• What to bring
Curiosity

events.name: Sunday Morning Meetup - Virtual Edition
events.organiser: Gay Men Of South Jersey Social Group
events.description_html:
Please join us every Sunday morning 11 AM - 1 PM online until we can meet again in person. Community is important, South Jersey. Let's deepen our connections to one another online until we can see each other again in the not too distant future.

Important: You must RSVP to receive the meeting ID and password. The password will change each meeting. The link to the meeting with the password embedded will be sent only to those who have RSVP'd on Sunday morning shortly before the meeting. Check the Meetup app prior to the meeting for the link. You must authenticate with the Zoom app using your email address, Google account, or Facebook account.

Desktop/laptop instructions:
1. Join Zoom Meeting (video) by entering the meeting ID and password.
The meeting ID and password will be sent each week to those who have RSVPd. If you do not RSVP you will not be able to attend the meeting.
2. Once the link is clicked, a pop up will appear entitled “Open Zoom Meetings?”
3. Click “Open Zoom Meetings” button.
4. Another pop-up will appear entitled "Choose ONE of the audio conference options"
5. Click "Join with Computer Audio" button.
6. When the host appears on the screen, you are all set!
7. If your computer is not working, you can also dial in by phone using these steps:
[masked], MEETING ID, PASSWORD, THEN POUND SIGN

Smartphone and tablet instructions:

events.name: Dharma Buddies Sunday Gathering - Online via Zoom
events.description_html:
We invite you to join your Dharma Buddies for our weekly Sunday gathering online via Zoom. Our weekly meetings are currently following an abbreviated schedule and are an hour in total.

Dharma Buddies is a Buddhist meditation and discussion group for gay, bisexual, and transgender men in the Seattle area.

Buddhist women may want to check out the Lotus Sisters group.

The Animal Liberation Online Assembly starts April 18th, 2020! In our kick-off event of this series, we’ll reveal all the details on the schedule of events happening from April 18th through the end of May. We’ll also be hearing from exciting guest speakers, listening to some live music, and announcing a new program we’re launching to strengthen our global community.

We’re transforming our annual conference into a series of online events - offering training, inspiration, and support to more people from around the world than ever before.

Register (free) on Eventbrite to secure your place and get details about all the events we have coming up in the next 2 months!
--------------------------------------------------------------------
The Animal Liberation Online Assembly is sowing the seeds of our movement. This online event series is an opportunity to learn about strategy, tactics, and community building, as we dive into understanding how social change happens, and how we’re going to get it for animals. Connect with activists from around the world, and learn from leaders in the animal rights movement and beyond.

Don’t miss this opportunity to connect with like-minded people and learn from leaders. Together, we will put liberation into action with our own hearts, minds, and hands.

All are welcome, including those new to activism and veganism. You must register to attend.

WHEN: Online events happening from April 18th through the end of May.
PROGRAM: Register to receive updates and details about upcoming events.

REGISTER HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/animal-liberation-online-assembly-tickets-101603573022

events.name: How to Change the World in One Generation - DxE Intro Workshop
events.organiser: Direct Action Everywhere: People Who Love Animals
events.description_html:
CALL-IN LINK: https://zoom.us/j/371918538

This month, we're holding our regular DxE Intro Workshop online. It's especially important in these times that we build organized communities that can support each other and raise awareness of the devastating impact of animal exploitation on all life on this planet.

A call-in Zoom link will be circulated at 12:30pm, 3/22 (30 minutes before the workshop begins) to everyone who marks themselves as attending this event.

- - -

Right now the most vulnerable individuals are being exploited on a massive scale and it will only get worse if we don’t take action now. But can we as average citizens really make a difference to help them? The answer is YES. In Direct Action Everywhere’s workshop, you will learn the history of social movements, the ground-breaking new research that shows the power of ordinary people, and the bold plan to nonviolently abolish the most harmful industry on earth that kills billions of animals every year.

This interactive workshop was created by DxE co-founder and former Northwestern law professor Wayne Hsiung. After this workshop you will have the tools to begin taking high impact action with thousands around the world to create historic change by saving billions of lives.

If you're interested in joining our community for change by becoming a chapter member, this workshop is required. Sign-up to be a chapter member at dxe.io/apply.

---

Direct Action Everywhere (DxE) is a grassroots network of animal rights activists. Through open rescue, demonstration, and disruption, we are creating a world where every animal is safe, happy and free.

DxE cultivates a welcoming and supportive community. We ask that all those who attend our events (online and offline) respect our Code of Conduct which can be reviewed at dxe.io/conduct

[LOCATION INFORMATION N/A]

To learn about our vision, goals, strategy and more check out the San Francisco Bay Area chapter Activist Handbook here: https://dxe.io/sfbayhandbook

If you have any questions or concerns, please e-mail [masked]

events.name: The History and Cosmology of LSD with Hamilton Morris and Chris Bache, Ph.D
events.description_html:
Join the Brooklyn Psychedelic Society this Bicycle Day for two in-depth discussions and Q+A with Christopher Bache, Ph.D, author of LSD and the Mind of the Universe and Hamilton Morris, chemist, writer, and host of Hamilton's Pharmacopeia on VICE.

You can get tickets here: https://www.tickettailor.com/events/brooklynpsychedelicsociety/367715

In his book LSD and the Mind of the Universe, religious studies professor Chris Bache chronicled his 73 high-dose LSD sessions that were carefully designed to follow the protocols established by Stan Grof, the historic LSD psychiatrist and researcher. While LSD is frequently touted for its psychological and therapeutic benefits, Chris's careful pursuit of LSD as a catalyst for spiritual insight is a path only a handful have publicly talked about. We are honored to have Chris join us to speak on LSD from a cosmological and spiritual perspective.

Hamilton Morris is a chemist, writer, host of Hamilton's Pharmacopeia on VICE, and a walking and talking wikipedia with footnotes when it comes to psychedelic science and history. We'll be talking about the scientific and cultural history of LSD, with some assured detours into hopefully adjacent topics.

Our interview with Chris will start at 3pm EST. Our interview with Hamilton will start at 6pm EST. Each talk will be followed up with a live Q+A from the audience (they will each be livestreamed on YouTube).

This talk is DONATION BASED, with a requested donation for each talk at $10, or $15 for both.

Link to Chris Bache ticket page: https://buytickets.at/brooklynpsychedelicsociety/367717

Link to Hamilton Morris ticket page: https://buytickets.at/brooklynpsychedelicsociety/367721

If you would like to attend, but can not afford to, you can go on each individual ticket page to register for each talk for free. We kindly ask that you please purchase a ticket if you can afford to do so.

If you have any questions, feel free to email [masked].

events.name: Not all bad? Are there any upsides to the present situation?
events.description_html:
The world has changed. We're poorer, less mobile, hunkering in fear from an invisible enemy. No longer seeing friends and family, no longer able to travel, to sit in bars, cinemas and cafes, no longer travelling to offices, no longer performing those activities which decades of common sense has told us are vital and virtuous, and resisting instincts that for physical connection that millions of years of evolution as a social species tell us to follow.

But are there some upsides to the present lockdown, the present mindset, the shared threat and the new-found common purpose which the pandemic has brought? Where's the light in this darkness, and can it brighter still after the shield has lifted than it was before?

In this discussion, I'd like us to think through some of the potential upsides to the present situation, and how they can be sustained and amplified in the longer term.
Domains for hope include:
- the environment and sustainable living: Can we now learn to live well sustainably?
- community spirit and solidarity: Has a common challenge revealed common humanity?
- The economy: Are we now able to better realise what work is really 'essential', and what work is simply a pretext for displays of power and subjugation?
- Workplace practices: Have we now discovered better tools and mindsets for addressing urgent challenges, for working collaboratively, effectively, across time and space, and which allow better balance between work life and home life?
- Education and learning: will the closing of schools, colleges and universities bring focus on new ways of distributed learning that open continual education to all, at all ages, instead of a few privileged young adults for just a few years?

Let's discuss.
Take care, Jon

events.name: There There: listen together to the audio book: 3/8 (over Zoom)
events.description_html:
Join us to listen to this book on audio book! After saying "hi" we will turn off our videos and mute so we can listen while we cook, eat, clean, rest...whatever. The audio book is 8 hours long so we plan to meet 5 more times for an hour. We will plan next reading times together...with those that attend.

* Please try to be on time or a little early so we can listen for a full hour.

We'll discuss the book on May 13th. You don't need to listen with us. You can get the book and read it on your own. This is an option for those who might find it hard to get the book while the libraries are closed.

"This is the first novel by Cheyenne and Arapaho author Tommy Orange. Published in 2018, it opens with an essay by Orange as a prologue, and then proceeds to follow a large cast of Native Americans living in the area of Oakland, California, as they struggle with a wide array of challenges ranging from depression and alcoholism, to unemployment, fetal alcohol syndrome, and the challenges of living with an ethnic identity of being "ambiguously nonwhite." All coalesce at a community pow wow and its attempted robbery.

"The book explores the themes of Native peoples living in urban spaces (Urban Indians), and issues of ambivalence and complexity related to Natives' struggles with identity and authenticity. There There was favorably received, and was a finalist for the 2019 Pulitzer Prize. The book was also awarded a Gold Medal for First Fiction by the California Book Awards."
source for above: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/There_There_(novel)
(sorry, I couldn't find the author's website, my preference, Deb)

All are welcome.

The ZOOM link will be posted sometime before the meeting in the comments. Only folks who RSVP will be allowed into the meeting.

events.name: Re-Connect with Your Authentic Self Weekend Retreat
events.description_html:
Let's SPRING Forward to celebrate World Breathing Day...

... I wonder how much more magical your life will be when you REconnect with your Authentic Self?  Imagine spending a weekend immersed in beauty, calm, peace.  Can you feel yourself strip away the density that you may be carrying that is likely weighing you down? Let's Spring forward to:

Re-Connect with your Authentic - Self 
Breathwork, Sound Healing and Meditation Immersion Retreat Weekend 

Pause...come to the peaceful foothills of the Big Valley...into a Little Bit of Heaven...far away from distractions...reconnect and deepen into your soul.
Breathwork sessions, a Sound Bath, Meditations for healing, insight and expansion of  consciousness...and authentic Italian cooking to taste La Dolce Vita, the sweet life that is awaiting YOU!
Each day there will be sessions, meditations, reflection time and yummy meals. The focus of our sessions will be to open energy pathways, release the old, quiet the mind, expand your heart and experience the sweetness, stillness and ease of your Authentic - Self.
This group will be small and intimate to allow for a safe and sacred space to Reconnect with you. 

Breathwork is a gentle yogic breathing practice and its effects are immediate and permanent. It's an effective way to heal on an Emotional, Mental, Physical and Spiritual levels. The effects of are cumulative, each session builds on the next. A deep healing and peaceful practice.
This new year ahead is brimming with possibility!

events.name: Zoom: Let's Meet Up and Stitch!
events.description_html:
Grab a beverage and your favorite craft and join us!

Due to current events we are meeting up online! We are using Zoom's free conference call app on phone, tablet or computer to spend time crafting and chatting together. Show off your pets, crafts and craft rooms or jut hang out! We generally have 9-18 people every time.

The link to our Zoom log in can be found on our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/groups/sanbernardinosipandstitch

If you don't have Facebook or want to join our group, please message me here and I will provide the link.

events.name: Craft with us Sunday morning in Bay Ridge!
events.organiser: Bay Ridge Knit and Crochet Circle
events.description_html:
To those who've stuck with us via Zoom, we are tremendously grateful. Our crafting time has been an important focal point of my week, and it makes me feel more human to see my friends crafting up a storm. We continue to meet via Zoom, and we'd love to see you and whatever project you're working on. You should be able to see the Zoom link when you RSVP.

__________________________________

In name, we’re a knitting and crochet circle. In actuality, we celebrate all artisans. Chainmaille? Awesome! Cross-stitch? Lovely! Magic tricks? Right on! Felting? Wowsa! Calligraphy? We won’t shake the table! Whatever you create, we want to celebrate your creativity/engineering/artistry.

The group truly welcomes all sorts of humans who practice all sorts of art. We’re as happy to meet seasoned knitters as we are to meet embroiderers who are picking up a needle for the first time. We enjoy each other’s company, and we’re pretty sure we’ll enjoy yours.

Stakes are low, so come by and say hi if you’re not sure this is the right group for you. Hang out with us once and then make up your mind. There’s no fee, and you were going to get a cup’o’Joe anyway.

If you’re interested in trying to knit or crochet for the first time, feel free to let us know ahead of time. The organizers are happy to bring yarn, needles/hooks, and even some instruction books for experimentation and learning. We’ve chosen not to have a class structure, but instead to encourage members to share skills and pass along knowledge the way it’s been done for centuries. (We’re also cool with people hanging out and learning from YouTube tutorials.)

We look forward to seeing you!

events.name: Virtual London Quilting Circle Meetup & Joint Project
events.description_html:
Hello Members!

Thanks so much for joining the group and thanks to all who have sent me feedback on what you would like to see in a Quilting Circle!
This is obviously not the best time to be starting a face-to-face meetup! So I have been thinking of ways that we might be able to get the group going without breaking the Social Distancing rules.

I have started by creating this Meetup which will be held o Google Hangouts. I thought that it would be nice to say hello to you all, even if we cannot meet in person.

I also thought that it would be a nice way to break the ice to try a group project that we could work on by creating individual blocks in our own homes and bring together when we can. Perhaps we could find a way to donate the finished project to an organisation that we are all happy with – either through a charity sale or finding an organisation that could actually use the quilt.

A lot of the feedback that I received said that people would like to try new techniques as part of the group so I thought that we could either vote on a technique and use it throughout the project, or choose individual techniques and put different blocks together to create a ‘mish-mash’ quilt. As long as all the blocks are the same size…. That way we will all have the opportunity to try something that we would like to.

So during our virtual meetup, we would need to make the following decisions:
- Size of our project
- Technique(s) we will use to create our project
- Where is should be donated to
- When / how we will finish the project

There are some ideas here (and many more options out there):

https://www.alicecaroline.com/quilt-sos/

https://www.crafterscompanion.co.uk/page/quilt4kindness/

Please join the meetup if you are interested! Looking forward to meeting you!

events.name: Online!  Toronto Collage Collective Meetup
events.description_html:
To keep everyone safe during the COVID-19 pandemic, the Toronto Collage Collective is going online!

Here's how it works. Each week during the pandemic, we'll individually make a collage on a given theme. The theme will be the same as the one chosen by @gluetogether on Instagram. Then on Sunday, we'll get together on Zoom to show our work, ask questions and offer support. It's a great way to motivate yourself if you're isolated at home, and an opportunity to connect and learn with others.

This week's theme is "Flowers," and you can see some examples of collages created by @gluetogether artists here: https://www.instagram.com/gluetogether/ and https://www.instagram.com/explore/tags/gluetogether/.

If you need some ideas to get started, you could consider:

- choose only one image and make a collage from it
- choose one image, make copies of it, and make a collage from it
- give yourself 30 minutes to choose 3 images and make a collage
- make a black and white collage, or a collage using only one colour
- make a collage where the individual pieces are all circles
- make up any other conditions you like to challenge yourself!

This event is free, and I hope you'll be able to join us on Zoom at https://us04web.zoom.us/j/75034468826.

Hope to see you there!

If you are completely new to sewing, I will be happy to suggest good beginner projects and resources. More than anything, this is an opportunity to socialize, exchange skills and get us through this hopefully brief period of 'sewcial' isolation!

Please note you need a computer or a laptop/ tablet with a camera and microphone enabled.
This meeting is free to attend, however please consider sponsoring us on patron:
https://www.patreon.com/sewntell

I'm looking forward to meeting you!

events.organiser: FREE Los Angeles Online Language Exchange and Intl Meetup
events.description_html:
💻 Zoom links for meetups:
*Password: 777 (If necessary)

*Click the link below after the scheduled time

＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝

📱💻 *FREE* Online English / Japanese Language Exchange =『無料』オンライン日英ランゲージ・エクスチェンジ
*Free talk language exchange between English and Japanese
*フリートークの日本語と英語のランゲージエクスチェンジです

This is a *FREE* online meetup that you can easily participate if you have a smartphone or a PC in a safe environment such as at home to prevent COVID-19.

We do video chatting by using the "ZOOM" app. "ZOOM Cloud Meetings" app (for Smartphone and Tablet PC) or "Zoom Client for Meetings" app (for PC) which you can get from the link below, App Store, or Google Play.
*You have to install the app, but you don't have to create an account.
*Please check the link below for how to use the "Zoom" app.

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 Flow

📱 Before this meetup

Apply on this page.
↓
Install the "Zoom" app.
↓
Check the following rules before the meetup.
- This meetup is held 40 minutes and stops automatically.
- Click "Zoom Link for Meetup" after the scheduled time.
- Each group is from 2 to 8 people.
- "Organizer" organizes only, don't talk in this meetup.
- Be sure to have a camera and a microphone.
- Video chat participation is required.
- We do not lecture on how to use smartphones, PCs or apps.
- Keep one person talking within 20 seconds.
- Cooperate so that all participants have the same chance to speak.
- Talk to people with a "Nickname".
- Help and respect each other for good communication.
- Prepare a short self-introduction (Nickname, Country of origin, City where you live) in advance.
- Think about the topic in advance and decide together what topic we will talk about.

📱 At the time of meetup participation

Click the "Zoom links for meetups" at the top to join.
*Use your name as you registered in "Meetup".
↓
Push the "Join Breakout Room" button.
*We invited you to join the breakout room
*Smartphone: Touch the screen of the Zoom app and a button will appear at the top left of the screen.
*PC: Button is at the bottom right of the Zoom app
↓
Start within 2-5 minutes.
Short self-introduction each other.
Decide together what topic we will talk about.
Start a conversation.
↓
Automatically ends after around 40 minutes.

📱 Feedback
Please give us feedback on getting better from the following link.
https://bit.ly/3boZAwf

＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝

新型コロナウイルス感染症対策のため、ご自宅等の安心な環境で、スマホやPCがあればどなたでも気軽に参加できる無料のオンライン交流会です。

交流会では『ZOOM』というアプリを使用しビデオ通話で行います。『ZOOM Cloud Meetings』アプリ (スマートフォンやタブレット端末用)『ミーティング用Zoomクライアント』アプリ（PC用）アプリは下記リンクや App Store、Google Play で入手できます。
※参加はアプリのインストールが必要ですがアカウントの作成は不要です
※"Zoom"アプリの使い方は下記リンクより確認ください

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 流れ

📱 交流会参加前

こちらのページの参加ボタンを押してください。
↓
『Zoom』アプリをインストール。
↓
交流会前に以下のルールを確認ください。
- 交流会は開始から約40分で自動的に終了します。
- 『Zoom Link for Meetup』はイベント開始時間後に押してください。
- 交流会は2名から6名のグループで行います。
- オーガナイザーは交流会の管理のみで参加しません。
- カメラとマイクを必ず用意すること。
- ビデオチャットでの参加が必須です。
- スマホ、パソコン、アプリの使い方の案内はしません。
- 一人が話す時間は20秒以内に留めること。
- すべての参加者が平等に話せるよう協力ください。
- 相手を「ニックネーム」で呼び会話することを心掛けましょう。
- 良いコミュニケーションをするためにお互い尊重し、助け合いましょう。
- 事前に自己紹介（ニックネーム、出身国、住んでいる街）を準備ください。
- 事前に話す話題を考え、何を話すか一緒に決めましょう。

📱 交流会開始時

一番上の『Zoom links for meetups』を押す。
*参加の際はMeetup登録の名前で参加すること
↓
『ブレイクアウトセッションに参加』ボタンを押す。
*オーガナイザーがブレイクアウトセッションに招待します
*スマホ: Zoomアプリの画面をタッチすると画面左上にボタンが現れます
*PC: Zoomアプリの右下にボタンがあります
↓
約3-5分後に開始します。
それぞれ短時間の自己紹介をしましょう。
それぞれ用意した話題を披露し、皆で話し合う話題を決めましょう。
話題が決まったら会話を始めてください。
↓
約40分後に自動的に終了します。

📱 フィードバック
今後の改善のため下記リンクからご意見をお願いします。
https://bit.ly/3boZAwf

- How to use Jupiter and Anaconda notebooks,
