📱💻 *FREE* Online English / Japanese Language Exchange =『無料』オンライン日英ランゲージ・エクスチェンジ
*Free talk language exchange between English and Japanese
*フリートークの日本語と英語のランゲージエクスチェンジです

This is a *FREE* online meetup that you can easily participate if you have a smartphone or a PC in a safe environment such as at home to prevent COVID-19.

We do video chatting by using the "ZOOM" app. "ZOOM Cloud Meetings" app (for Smartphone and Tablet PC) or "Zoom Client for Meetings" app (for PC) which you can get from the link below, App Store, or Google Play.
*You have to install the app, but you don't have to create an account.
*Please check the link below for how to use the "Zoom" app.

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 Flow

📱 Before this meetup

Apply on this page.
↓
Install the "Zoom" app.
↓
Check the following rules before the meetup.
- This meetup is held 40 minutes and stops automatically.
- Click "Zoom Link for Meetup" after the scheduled time.
- Each group is from 2 to 8 people.
- "Organizer" organizes only, don't talk in this meetup.
- Be sure to have a camera and a microphone.
- Video chat participation is required.
- We do not lecture on how to use smartphones, PCs or apps.
- Keep one person talking within 20 seconds.
- Cooperate so that all participants have the same chance to speak.
- Talk to people with a "Nickname".
- Help and respect each other for good communication.
- Prepare a short self-introduction (Nickname, Country of origin, City where you live) in advance.
- Think about the topic in advance and decide together what topic we will talk about.

📱 At the time of meetup participation

Click the "Zoom links for meetups" at the top to join.
*Use your name as you registered in "Meetup".
↓
Push the "Join Breakout Room" button.
*We invited you to join the breakout room
*Smartphone: Touch the screen of the Zoom app and a button will appear at the top left of the screen.
*PC: Button is at the bottom right of the Zoom app
↓
Start within 2-5 minutes.
Short self-introduction each other.
Decide together what topic we will talk about.
Start a conversation.
↓
Automatically ends after around 40 minutes.

📱 Feedback
Please give us feedback on getting better from the following link.
https://bit.ly/3boZAwf

＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝

新型コロナウイルス感染症対策のため、ご自宅等の安心な環境で、スマホやPCがあればどなたでも気軽に参加できる無料のオンライン交流会です。

交流会では『ZOOM』というアプリを使用しビデオ通話で行います。『ZOOM Cloud Meetings』アプリ (スマートフォンやタブレット端末用)『ミーティング用Zoomクライアント』アプリ（PC用）アプリは下記リンクや App Store、Google Play で入手できます。
※参加はアプリのインストールが必要ですがアカウントの作成は不要です
※"Zoom"アプリの使い方は下記リンクより確認ください

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 流れ

📱 交流会参加前

こちらのページの参加ボタンを押してください。
↓
『Zoom』アプリをインストール。
↓
交流会前に以下のルールを確認ください。
- 交流会は開始から約40分で自動的に終了します。
- 『Zoom Link for Meetup』はイベント開始時間後に押してください。
- 交流会は2名から6名のグループで行います。
- オーガナイザーは交流会の管理のみで参加しません。
- カメラとマイクを必ず用意すること。
- ビデオチャットでの参加が必須です。
- スマホ、パソコン、アプリの使い方の案内はしません。
- 一人が話す時間は20秒以内に留めること。
- すべての参加者が平等に話せるよう協力ください。
- 相手を「ニックネーム」で呼び会話することを心掛けましょう。
- 良いコミュニケーションをするためにお互い尊重し、助け合いましょう。
- 事前に自己紹介（ニックネーム、出身国、住んでいる街）を準備ください。
- 事前に話す話題を考え、何を話すか一緒に決めましょう。

📱 交流会開始時

一番上の『Zoom links for meetups』を押す。
*参加の際はMeetup登録の名前で参加すること
↓
『ブレイクアウトセッションに参加』ボタンを押す。
*オーガナイザーがブレイクアウトセッションに招待します
*スマホ: Zoomアプリの画面をタッチすると画面左上にボタンが現れます
*PC: Zoomアプリの右下にボタンがあります
↓
約3-5分後に開始します。
それぞれ短時間の自己紹介をしましょう。
それぞれ用意した話題を披露し、皆で話し合う話題を決めましょう。
話題が決まったら会話を始めてください。
↓
約40分後に自動的に終了します。

📱 フィードバック
今後の改善のため下記リンクからご意見をお願いします。
https://bit.ly/3boZAwf

events.name: Virtual Challenge: National Library Week 📚💚
events.description_html:
Find Your Place at the Library.

Celebrate and show your support for libraries all this week on social media! #NationalLibraryWeek #LibrariesTransform

Sunday, 4/19: Follow the library on social media: Facebook @saclibrary | Instagram @saclib | Twitter @saclib | www.saclibrary.org

Monday, 4/20: Join us for Live Reading Recommendations @ 4 p.m. on Facebook to discover your next favorite read!

Tuesday, 4/21: Check out our Dial-A-Poem service in celebration of National Poetry Month. Call[masked] and enjoy a poem read by a librarian.

Wednesday, 4/22: Share a #shelfie of your bookshelf at home and tag @saclib on social media.

Thursday, 4/23: Join us for the Virtual Library Happy Hour @ 5 p.m. via Zoom as we chat about everything under the sun.

Friday, 4/24: Pick up a book and READ! Enjoy the day :)

Saturday, 4/25: Join us for the Library AF Book Club @ 11 a.m. via Zoom as we discuss "the sun and her flowers" by Rupi Kaur.

events.name: [ONLINE] Faulkner (2 of 5), Absalom, Absalom! Please read Chapters 3 and 4
events.organiser: Let's Read! Classics from the Western Canon
events.description_html:
For April 19, 2020, we continue with Faulkner's Absalom, Absalom! The Corrected Text. Please read Chapters Three and Four.

Preferred Edition:
Vintage International, 1990, ISBN:[masked]

Please note: During our COVID-19 time on Zoom the two sections will be consolidated into one section starting at 10AM alternate Sundays..

Join Zoom Meeting at start time:
https://zoom.us/j/900211759

Meeting ID:[masked]

New Zoom security measures involve Registration, Password and an Awaiting Room stay prior to joining the meeting. I would advise registering now, good for all of our recurring sessions. The password will be released one hour/day prior to meeting. The host will admit (authenticate) you from the Awaiting Room.

To join via telephone (audio-only):
[masked],,[masked]#

For this session, there will be a fee of $1 -payable by credit card- for all attendees to cover the monthly Zoom Pro fee of $14.99. This cost will cover all Zoom sessions scheduled by David Johnson between April 20 -May 18, 2020.

For our Faulkner reading, we'll be splitting Absalom, Absalom! The Corrected Text into five sessions and, finishing that, we'll proceed onto King Lear (two sessions). When we finish Lear, we'll begin Nietzsche's Thus Spake Zarathustra (# sessions TBD).

See the following schedule for clarification:

Faulkner's Absalom, Absalom! The Corrected Text
Discussion 1: April 5: Chapters 1 & 2
Discussion 2: April 19: Chapters 3 & 4
Discussion 3: May 3: Chapters 5 & 6
Discussion 4: May 17: Chapter 7
Discussion 5: May 31: Chapters 8 & 9

Shakespeare's King Lear:
Discussion 1: June 14: Acts 1 & 2
Discussion 2: June 28: Acts 3, 4 & 5

Nietzsche's Thus Spake Zarathustra
Discussion 1: July 12, 2020 (first of TBD sessions)

PARKING [once we return from Zoom]
One attractive feature of this venue is that there is usually free and ample parking on the street on Sundays which is when we meet. This week, because of the Westwood closure, parking will not be quite as available, but it will still be free.

events.name: (Online Discussion) Film: "Parasite" Discussion
events.description_html:
(Online) Film: "Parasite" Discussion

In this difficult time our club will be hosting regular online discussions. Let's get together and keep the social connection going!

--------------------

📌 About the movie:

🏆 Arguably one of the most talked about films of 2019, Parasite is the first Korean film to win the Cannes Palme d'Or and the first to win with a unanimous vote since 2013's Blue Is the Warmest Colour. It won the leading four awards at the 92nd Academy Awards, the first film not in English to win Best Picture. It has received over 180 awards from around the world.

🍅 99% recommendation by critics:
https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/parasite_2019

"Critics Consensus:
An urgent, brilliantly layered look at timely social themes, Parasite finds writer-director Bong Joon Ho in near-total command of his craft."

--------------------

📌 How to join:
Please RSVP to see meeting link.

-------------------

▶ Our events are conducted in English
▶ Kat has reviewed theater in New York. Her Meetups have been to over 28 countries.

events.name: ONLINE - Anthony Burgess' - A Clockwork Orange
events.description_html: A Clockwork Orange is a dystopian satirical black comedy novel by English writer Anthony Burgess, published in 1962. It is set in a near-future society that has a youth subculture of extreme violence. The teenage protagonist, Alex, narrates his violent exploits and his experiences with state authorities intent on reforming him.[1] The book is partially written in a Russian-influenced argot called "Nadsat", which takes its name from the Russian suffix that is equivalent to '-teen' in English.[2] According to Burgess, it was a jeu d'esprit written in just three weeks.[3]</p> In 2005, A Clockwork Orange was included on Time magazine's list of the 100 best English-language novels written since 1923,[4] and it was named by Modern Library and its readers as one of the 100 best English-language novels of the 20th century.[5] The original manuscript of the book has been located at McMaster University's William Ready Division of Archives and Research Collections in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada since the institution purchased the documents in 1971.[6]</p>

events.name: Time to Read- Now an Online Meeting!
events.organiser: Not Your Average Book Club- Alexandria
events.description_html:
Due to COVID-19 and the continued need for social distancing, meetings from this date forward will be scheduled via Zoom.

To join, copy and paste the link below at the start of the meeting time. You do not need to do anything prior to the meeting to prepare.

Because these meetings will be online, they will obviously be a little different than our normal meetings! Feel free to bring your own breakfast/coffee and get ready to chat! We can talk about books you've read during this crazy time or just how you have been doing these last few weeks. You are welcome to bring a book, but due to the social isolation of the last few weeks I would like to use this time to socialize as much as possible.

If you cannot make it right at 10am, that is fine! The link is good for 10am-1pm so you can join anytime during this time slot.

See you soon!

events.name: A Memory Called Empire: Arkady Martine
events.description_html:
Book Summary:
Ambassador Mahit Dzmare arrives in the center of the multi-system Teixcalaanli Empire only to discover that her predecessor, the previous ambassador from their small but fiercely independent mining Station, has died. But no one will admit that his death wasn't an accident—or that Mahit might be next to die, during a time of political instability in the highest echelons of the imperial court.

Now, Mahit must discover who is behind the murder, rescue herself, and save her Station from Teixcalaan's unceasing expansion—all while navigating an alien culture that is all too seductive, engaging in intrigues of her own, and hiding a deadly technological secret—one that might spell the end of her Station and her way of life—or rescue it from annihilation.

Facebook event: www.facebook.com/events/[masked]/
GoodReads event: www.goodreads.com/event/show/[masked]-a-memory-called-empire-arkady-martine

events.name: The Hidden Life of Trees --  Peter Wohlleben
events.organiser: Between the Lines: A Las Vegas Book Discussion Group
events.description_html:
The full title is: The Hidden Life of Trees: What They Feel, How They Communicate – Discoveries from a Secret World

In The Hidden Life of Trees, Peter Wohlleben shares his deep love of woods and forests and explains the amazing processes of life, death, and regeneration he has observed in the woodland and the amazing scientific processes behind the wonders of which we are blissfully unaware. Much like human families, tree parents live together with their children, communicate with them, and support them as they grow, sharing nutrients with those who are sick or struggling and creating an ecosystem that mitigates the impact of extremes of heat and cold for the whole group. As a result of such interactions, trees in a family or community are protected and can live to be very old. In contrast, solitary trees, like street kids, have a tough time of it and in most cases die much earlier than those in a group.

Drawing on groundbreaking new discoveries, Wohlleben presents the science behind the secret and previously unknown life of trees and their communication abilities; he describes how these discoveries have informed his own practices in the forest around him. As he says, a happy forest is a healthy forest, and he believes that eco-friendly practices not only are economically sustainable but also benefit the health of our planet and the mental and physical health of all who live on Earth.

events.name: VIRTUAL MEETING: "One of Us Is Lying" by Karen M. McManus
events.organiser: I love YA Fiction--even though I am no longer a teen
events.description_html:
ZOOM LINK WILL BE SENT OUT THE DAY BEFORE THE MEETUP SO PLEASE RSVP EVEN IF YOU'RE UNDECIDED! (We won't get mad at you for signing up and then cancelling.)

Meet for a discussion of "One of Us Is Lying" by Karen M. McManus.

Summary: Pay close attention and you might solve this.
On Monday afternoon, five students at Bayview High walk into detention.
Bronwyn, the brain, is Yale-bound and never breaks a rule.
Addy, the beauty, is the picture-perfect homecoming princess.
Nate, the criminal, is already on probation for dealing.
Cooper, the athlete, is the all-star baseball pitcher.
And Simon, the outcast, is the creator of Bayview High’s notorious gossip app.

Only, Simon never makes it out of that classroom. Before the end of detention Simon's dead. And according to investigators, his death wasn’t an accident. On Monday, he died. But on Tuesday, he’d planned to post juicy reveals about all four of his high-profile classmates, which makes all four of them suspects in his murder. Or are they the perfect patsies for a killer who’s still on the loose?

events.name: April Special: The Plague, by Albert Camus (ZOOM VIDEO CALL)
events.organiser: Cambridge Book Club for Awesome, Amazing, Readers like YOU
events.description_html:
For a special edition April selection, we will be reading THE PLAGUE (or La peste), by Albert Camus. (Seems appropriate.) Since we cannot meet in person for the foreseeable future, this meetup will be on ZOOM, a live video book club. We'll give it a try! I will send the link to the video meetup three days before to all who have signed up.

For those unfamiliar, here is a little about THE PLAGUE:

The Nobel prize-winning Albert Camus, who died in 1960, could not have known how current his existentialist novel of epidemic and death would remain. Set in Algeria, in northern Africa, The Plague is a powerful study of human life and its meaning in the face of a deadly virus that sweeps dispassionately through the city, taking a vast percentage of the population with it.

Hope to see you on my laptop screen!
Diane

events.description_html:
We agreed that while we are sheltering in place, our short story group will meet *weekly* to discuss *one* story from Best American Short Stories 2019 each week. We agreed to meet at *11 am* instead of 2 pm.

4/19, we'll discuss "Anyone Can Do It" from Best American Short Stories 2019.

To join our group, RSVP here to the 4/19 meeting. A few minutes before 11 on the meeting date, click or copy/paste the link with the embedded password. If you attended our 4/12 meeting, the same link will work for all future short story Zoom meetings. If new people attend this one who didn't get the 4/12 link, I'll send it out again.

This is part of an ongoing short story study group. If you haven't attended our meetings, you're welcome to join our group.

Be sure to RSVP to each Novel Lovers and short story meeting you want to attend. Check all your current RSVPs, please.

events.name: [VIRTUAL] Nonfiction Discussion: Educated  📚 (Event B)
events.description_html:
[COVID-19 UPDATE] Until further notice, Avidly Literate will meet digitally at our normally scheduled times. (So, to be clear, do not go to the coffee shop. Instead, stay at home and we will talk over the internet.) I will reach out individually to everyone with details well before each meeting and to help people get set up with the software if they'd like some assistance. I will also do some upfront prep to provide our conversation with a structure that fits this new video conferencing format.

---

Hi readers! Let's meet up to see if we can figure out why "Educated" has been on the New York Times Best Sellers List for over two years 😊 (Get the book here: https://www.amazon.com/Educated-Memoir-Tara-Westover/dp/0399590501)

👩‍💻 Discussion inspiration topics: https://avidlyliterate.com/educated

No PhD is required 😅, though we do trust everyone has read the text 😇

In order to keep groups small there are multiple events held per book (named Event A, Event B, etc.). To give the maximum number of our members the opportunity to join a discussion, please only attend one discussion event per book.

Praise:

“Westover has somehow managed not only to capture her unsurpassably exceptional upbringing, but to make her current situation seem not so exceptional at all, and resonant for many others.”—The New York Times Book Review

#1 NEW YORK TIMES, WALL STREET JOURNAL, AND BOSTON GLOBE BESTSELLER • NAMED ONE OF THE TEN BEST BOOKS OF THE YEAR BY THE NEW YORK TIMES BOOK REVIEW • ONE OF PRESIDENT BARACK OBAMA’S FAVORITE BOOKS OF THE YEAR • BILL GATES’S HOLIDAY READING LIST • FINALIST FOR THE NATIONAL BOOK CRITICS CIRCLE’S AWARD IN AUTOBIOGRAPHY • FINALIST FOR THE NATIONAL BOOK CRITICS CIRCLE’S JOHN LEONARD PRIZE FOR BEST FIRST BOOK • FINALIST FOR THE PEN/JEAN STEIN BOOK AWARD • FINALIST FOR THE LOS ANGELES BOOK PRIZE

NAMED ONE OF PASTE’S BEST MEMOIRS OF THE DECADE • NAMED ONE OF THE BEST BOOKS OF THE YEAR BY The Washington Post • O: The Oprah Magazine • Time • NPR • Good Morning America • San Francisco Chronicle • The Guardian • The Economist • Financial Times • Newsday • New York Post • theSkimm • Refinery29 • Bloomberg • Self • Real Simple • Town & Country • Bustle • Paste • Publishers Weekly • Library Journal • LibraryReads • BookRiot • Pamela Paul, KQED • New York Public Library

events.name: Opera on Sydney Harbour - La Traviata
events.summary: Doors open 2 hours prior to performance time. Raise your glass, flutter those lashes. He's staring at you, he's singing for you… Are you tempted? Violetta is the life of every party. A courtesan with a heart of gold, she's free and free-spirited. Could a little love change everything? Experience the joy and heartache of the world's most popular opera at Sydney's best night out. Fireworks light up the sky at every performance. A giant chandelier shimmers over the harbour stage. Handa Opera on Sydney Harbour is "the ultimate Sydney experience" (Yahoo! Travel). Arrive early to enjoy drinks or dinner at one of the five pop-up bars and restaurants on site. Drink in the view as the setting sun glimmers over the city skyline. Then take your seats in the comfortable grandstand to enjoy "a ravishing visual spectacle" (Huffington Post). Brian Castles-Onion conducts the opera, with a live orchestra hidden under the stage.

This can include families with children, guests on the autism spectrum, guests with dementia, anyone with sensory or cognitive considerations or any individuals who prefer to watch the performance in a more flexible setting. Guests can come and go from their seats to make the evening more accommodating for persons with disability and their families.

events.name: Made In The 90's
events.summary: Running Times: Doors: 5:30pm Start: 6:30pm Finish: 10:30pm *All times are approximate and subject to change. Heading the line up is Grammy Winners, Blackstreet ("No Diggity", "You Blow My Mind") in their first ever Australian & New Zealand shows featuring their incredible band, hitmakers Next ("Too Close", "Wifey"), Grammy Winners All-4-One ("I Swear", "I Can Love You Like That") in their first Aussie shows in a decade and for their first ever Kiwi shows, r&b singer and producer, Mario Winans ("I Don't Wanna Know") in his first ever shows on our shores and Renee Neufville, one half of the dynamic Zhané ("Hey Mr. DJ"). The line up is rounded out by local r&b legends, CDB ("Lets Groove", "Hook Me Up"). Hosting this spectacular trip down memory lane is none other than one of the voices of '90s R&B group 112, Q Parker. Fans can expect full sets from all acts and over 4 hours of live r&b magic. Made in the '90s is back and an absolute must for any lover of the old school.

events.name: a day on the green - James Blunt (Concert & Dining)
events.summary: Concert & Dining: The all-inclusive Bimbadgen Concert & Dining Marquee includes a serviced bar and dining area in a deluxe marquee at the perimeter of the venue, and a Platinum Reserved seat within the Bimbadgen amphitheatre to watch the show. This marquee does not have a direct view of the stage. You will enjoy a three-course meal prepared by the Esca Bimbadgen restaurant team, as well as Bimbadgen wines, selected beers, and soft drinks as part of this all-inclusive package Children's Policy: Persons under 18 must be accompanied by a ticket-holding parent or legal guardian at all times. Prohibited Items: Strictly no BYO alcohol or non-alcoholic drinks (only exception is sealed plastic bottled water). No Metal cutlery (inc. cheese knives) or Glass. No Selfie & Go Pro sticks. No aerosols, sunshades, tents, tables & umbrellas (even if raining). No hard coolers, eskis, cooler bags larger than cabin size 26L. No Beanbags, blow-up air chairs or lounges.

events.name: Paul Kelly and Paul Grabowsky: Please Leave Your Light On
events.summary: Running Times: Doors - 6:30pm, Jess Hitchcock - 8:00pm, Finish - 10:30pm, *Please note all times are approximate and subject to change. Other than sharing the same moniker, Messrs. Kelly and Grabowsky are each regarded as the poet laureate in their chosen field - Kelly is counted amongst our most lauded wordsmiths while Grabowsky, our most noted note-smiths. Following a one-off performance at the bespoke arts space Ukaria in the Adelaide Hills, they concurred that this collaboration deserved further development. This performance will be feature works from their new album, taken mainly from Kelly's vast catalogue. Grabowsky, an astonishing musical polymath, draws from his extensive trove of musical knowledge, giving the original songs a fresh framework while never, never losing sight of Kelly's intent.

events.summary: Running Times: Doors: 7:00pm Start: 8:00pm Finish: 10:30pm *Please note, all times are approximate and subject to change. Baby Animals and Killing Heidi hit the road again for the 'Back 2 Back Tour 2020'. After the success of 2019's short 'Hits' tour both bands have been inundated with requests for a continuation of what was one of the biggest Rock events of 2019. From 'Early Warning' to 'Weir'. 'Rush You' to 'Mascara'; fans will be treated to all the favourites, and then some !

events.name: Nitro Circus Live - YOU GOT THIS TOUR
events.summary: Running Times: VIP Entry - 3:00pm General Doors - 4:00pm Showtime - 5:00pm All times are approximate and subject to change. Please note: The stunts performed in Nitro Circus Live are amongst the most dangerous in the world. When athletes are attempting insane stunts 40 feet in the air over a 75 foot gap, the weather conditions have to be perfect as the onset of rain, dew, wind or other factors could be fatal. That's why we are reserving one or more additional days (Sunday 28th February or Monday 1st March 2021 ) as possible alternative show dates in case we need to reschedule. When you buy your ticket, please make sure that you are available on the reserve days too in case we have to use them for a rescheduled show. If we do, there are no refunds.

events.name: Newcastle Knights v Penrith Panthers
events.summary: The 2020 NRL season will be impacted by the Government's directive that we suspend attendance by the general public at matches in Round 2 and until further notice. The NRL is working closely with clubs, states and the game's partners to address issues associated with the closure of matches to members and fans of the game (and other scenarios that may present). NRL Telstra Premiership games will be temporarily held from sale until further notice. We will provide our valued members and fans with updates as information about our approach comes to hand via NRL, club and state channels. Now, as much as ever, we value your constant support and understanding. Rugby league is known for its resilience and we know we will work through this together.

events.name: NSW Waratahs v Rebels
events.summary: Sydney's northern beaches turned it on in 2019, packing the hills of Brookvale Oval to support their Tahs and we want to fill 'Brookie' again this season! The second of three consecutive derbies at home, we'll take on a Melbourne Rebels side featuring the likes of Isi Naisarani, Marika Koroibete and Reece Hodge. Come and enjoy Super Rugby in the suburbs as we look to continue our winning ways against the Rebels! Run Times: 4:30pm - Gates open 7:15pm - Kick-off 9:00pm - Finish (approx.) *Please note times are approximate and subject to change. Concession applies Full-time Students, Pensioners and Seniors with valid ID. A Family Ticket consists of 2 Adults and 2 Juniors 4-16 Years.
